Asia Cup: Harbhajan Singh blasts Ajit Agarkar - 'I had hoped...'
Harbhajan Singh has criticized Ajit Agarkar's selection choices for India's Asia Cup squad, questioning the exclusion of Mohammed Siraj and Shreyas Iyer. Singh believes Siraj's 'X-factor' and Iyer's good form could have strengthened the team. The Asia Cup is set to begin on September 9, with India facing the United Arab Emirates.
Asia Cup: Harbhajan Singh blasts Ajit Agarkar for not picking two ‘X-factor’ cricketers - 'I had hoped...' | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsAsia Cup: Harbhajan Singh blasts Ajit Agarkar for not picking two ‘X-factor’ cricketers - 'I had hoped...'TrendingHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramUS Open 2025India Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramUS Open 2025India Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramUS Open 2025India Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarAsia Cup: Harbhajan Singh blasts Ajit Agarkar for not picking two ‘X-factor’ cricketers - 'I had hoped...'TOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 20, 2025, 10:10 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeHarbhajan Singh has criticized Ajit Agarkar's selection choices for India's Asia Cup squad, questioning the exclusion of Mohammed Siraj and Shreyas Iyer. Singh believes Siraj's 'X-factor' and Iyer's good form could have strengthened the team. The Asia Cup is set to begin on September 9, with India facing the United Arab Emirates. Indian Mens T20 Captain Suryakumar Yadav, left, and Chief Selector Ajit Agarkar during the press conference to announce the team for the Cricket Asia Cup 2025 at the BCCI Headquarters in Mumbai, India, Tuesday, Aug. 19, 2025. (AP Photo/Rajanish Kakade) Former India spinner Harbhajan Singh lambasted chairman of selectors Ajit Agarkar for leaving out two “X-factor” players from India’s 15-member squad for the Asia Cup.“I feel that Siraj’s name should have been included as well. Siraj bowled very well in the recent series," Harbhajan said on his YouTube channel.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!"Yes, he bowled a lot in England, but he also got adequate rest. So he could have been included."If he had been picked, the team would have looked even stronger. The bowling unit would have seemed stronger. I feel that the ‘X-factor’ Siraj brings might be somewhat missed," he added.Another omission that surprised Harbhajan was the absence of Shreyas Iyer from the squad.“I had hoped he (Shreyas Iyer) would get a place in the team. He scored a lot of runs, played in the IPL final, and was in very good form."I thought his name could have been there. As for whose spot he would take, that is for the selectors to decide."When someone has to be included or left out, a spot is made. But I did not see Shreyas Iyer’s name there, which surprised me a little," he added.The Asia Cup will begin on September 9, with defending champions India set to face hosts United Arab Emirates a day later in Dubai in the eight-nation tournament.PollIs Shreyas Iyer's exclusion from the squad surprising?Absolutely surprisingNot surprising at allSomewhat surprisingI don't follow the team closelyIndia and arch-rivals Pakistan have been placed in Group A and will clash on September 14.Pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah has also made a comeback to the T20 squad after skipping two matches in England to manage his workload.Bumrah’s last T20 outing was India’s World Cup title win over South Africa at Barbados in June 2024.With Kohli and Rohit retiring from T20 internationals after that triumph, Bumrah will lead the pace attack alongside left-arm quick Arshdeep Singh and Harshit Rana. Axar Patel, Varun Chakravarthy, and Kuldeep Yadav will handle the spin department.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

'Shreyas Iyer will be part of the team': Ex-cricketer explains how
Aakash Chopra has voiced his surprise over Shreyas Iyer's exclusion from the Asia Cup reserve players list, despite Iyer's impressive IPL 2025 performance where he scored 604 runs and led Punjab Kings to the final. Chopra believes this omission sends a negative signal regarding Iyer's T20I future.
Asia Cup | 'Shreyas Iyer will be part of the team': Ex-cricketer explains how | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsAsia Cup | 'Shreyas Iyer will be part of the team': Ex-cricketer explains howTrendingAakash ChopraMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarAakash ChopraMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarAakash ChopraMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarAsia Cup | 'Shreyas Iyer will be part of the team': Ex-cricketer explains howTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 20, 2025, 13:14 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAakash Chopra has voiced his surprise over Shreyas Iyer's exclusion from the Asia Cup reserve players list, despite Iyer's impressive IPL 2025 performance where he scored 604 runs and led Punjab Kings to the final. Chopra believes this omission sends a negative signal regarding Iyer's T20I future. Shreyas Iyer (Image credit: ICC Photo) NEW DELHI: Former India opener Aakash Chopra has expressed surprise at Shreyas Iyer’s exclusion from the reserve players list for the upcoming Asia Cup, pointing out that it doesn’t send the right message regarding his T20I future.Iyer, who piled up 604 runs at a strike rate of 175 in IPL 2025 while leading Punjab Kings to the runners-up spot, had shown marked improvement against the short ball and dominated spinners throughout the tournament. Yet, he found no place in either the 15-member squad for the Asia Cup or the five-man reserves list.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!The omission had earlier baffled former India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar, and now Chopra has voiced similar concerns. "Shreyas' name is not even there in the five reserves, and that is surprising. It's understandable that you couldn't have him in the 15 as you can't play him in the XI, and you wanted lower-order batters as backup, where Shivam Dube is there, and Rinku Singh will be given another chance, which is absolutely par for the course."However, a place could have been created in the reserve players at least, where you have kept Dhruv Jurel, Yashasvi Jaiswal and Prasidh Krishna. Shreyas’ name could have been there, but you haven't kept it there either, and that doesn't send a great signal. The clarity in front of Shreyas' name is completely not there," Chopra said on his YouTube channel on Wednesday.At the same time, Chopra believes Iyer’s international future is far from over and that he still has a pathway to the 2026 Men’s T20 World Cup if he maintains strong performances in ODIs. For now, Iyer’s immediate focus will be on representing West Zone in the Duleep Trophy, which marks the start of the 2025/26 domestic season.India Asia Cup squad: Why Shreyas Iyer and Shubman Gill are biggest talking points"Shreyas Iyer not being there is a big story. What more will Shreyas Iyer have to do? What more can you do than what you have already done? You had a 600-plus run IPL season, took the team to the final, scored runs in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, played Ranji, and won the Champions Trophy. That's all you can do as a human being."This is the Asia Cup team. Don't attach the World Cup with it because there are 15 T20Is after this. The world changes in 15 T20Is. If he keeps scoring runs in ODIs, sooner or later, Shreyas Iyer will be part of the team. I have a strong feeling that Shreyas Iyer will be a part of India's T20 World Cup team," he added.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Watch Here!About the AuthorTOI Sports DeskThe TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide. 

From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

Asia Cup: Gavaskar makes a big prediction about Gill's future - 'He could be leading...'
Sunil Gavaskar believes Shubman Gill's impressive form and IPL performance justify his Asia Cup vice-captaincy. Gavaskar suggests this role indicates Gill could lead India's T20 team in the future, praising his ability to handle pressure while leading in England. Regarding Yashasvi Jaiswal's omission, Gavaskar emphasizes supporting the selected team and avoiding unnecessary controversy.
Asia Cup 2025: Sunil Gavaskar makes a big prediction about Shubman Gill's future - 'He could be leading...' | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsAsia Cup 2025: Sunil Gavaskar makes a big prediction about Shubman Gill's future - 'He could be leading...'TrendingHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarAsia Cup 2025: Sunil Gavaskar makes a big prediction about Shubman Gill's future - 'He could be leading...'TOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 20, 2025, 12:29 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeSunil Gavaskar believes Shubman Gill's impressive form and IPL performance justify his Asia Cup vice-captaincy. Gavaskar suggests this role indicates Gill could lead India's T20 team in the future, praising his ability to handle pressure while leading in England. Regarding Yashasvi Jaiswal's omission, Gavaskar emphasizes supporting the selected team and avoiding unnecessary controversy. India captain Shubman Gill speaks during a press conference at Edgbaston, Birmingham, England, Tuesday July 1, 2025. AP/PTI(AP07_01_2025_000278A) Legendary India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar has predicted that Shubman Gill might end up leading the team in T20Is as well, after the 25-year-old was elevated as the team’s vice-captain for the Asia Cup."Not surprising at all. He (Shubman Gill) scored over 750 runs just a couple of weeks ago," Gavaskar told India Today.India Asia Cup squad: Why Shreyas Iyer and Shubman Gill are biggest talking pointsGo Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!"You cannot exclude a player in that kind of form. Also, he has done really well in the IPL, which concluded just before the tour to England."It's a very good inclusion. Giving him the vice-captaincy is also a way of telling him that in the future, he could be leading the T20 side. I think it’s a very, very good selection," he added."He was very impressive in England. To score 750-plus runs while leading the side for the first time shows how well he handled pressure."This vice-captaincy is a clear sign that he is going to be the captain of the Indian team as well. It's always good to have him take responsibility just a little bit earlier,” Gavaskar said.Gavaskar also refused to comment on Yashasvi Jaiswal's omission from the squad.PollHow do you rate Shubman Gill's performance in recent matches?OutstandingGoodAveragePoor"You can only pick XI in the match and you can only pick 15 in the squad. Somebody has to miss out; that's just how it is in Indian cricket," he said."No point in discussing whether A or B or C should've been there. This is now our team. We can all have our opinions before the selection committee picks the team, but once the team is picked, we should back it fully."We shouldn't be saying A should've been there or B should've been there. That only creates controversy, which the players don't need."Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. 'Shreyas is not liked as much as ... ': Ex-India coach blasts Gambhir and Agarkar
Shreyas Iyer's exclusion from both the Asia Cup squad and standby list has sparked controversy, despite his impressive IPL 2025 performance. Former assistant coach Abhishek Nayar questioned the decision, emphasizing Iyer's strong contention. Chief selector Ajit Agarkar acknowledged the difficulty of the decision, citing limited squad space.

': Ex-India coach blasts Gautam Gambhir and selector Ajit Agarkar - WATCH | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsAsia Cup | 'Shreyas Iyer is not liked as much as ... ': Ex-India coach blasts Gautam Gambhir and selector Ajit Agarkar - WATCHTrendingHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarAsia Cup | 'Shreyas Iyer is not liked as much as ... ': Ex-India coach blasts Gautam Gambhir and selector Ajit Agarkar - WATCHTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 20, 2025, 11:26 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeShreyas Iyer's exclusion from both the Asia Cup squad and standby list has sparked controversy, despite his impressive IPL 2025 performance. Former assistant coach Abhishek Nayar questioned the decision, emphasizing Iyer's strong contention. Chief selector Ajit Agarkar acknowledged the difficulty of the decision, citing limited squad space. Shreyas Iyer (AP Photo) NEW DELHI: India’s cricket selectors sprung a surprise by leaving out Shreyas Iyer from both the 15-member Asia Cup squad and the five standby players, despite his strong showings in the Champions Trophy and IPL 2025. The announcement was made by BCCI chief selector Ajit Agarkar and T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav on Tuesday.Iyer enjoyed an excellent IPL season, guiding Punjab Kings to the final while amassing 604 runs in 17 matches at a strike rate of 175.07. He finished as the sixth-highest run-scorer of the tournament.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!Former India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar voiced his disappointment at Iyer’s exclusion."I don't know, actually, I wanted to ask that question — aapke reserve players mein kaise nahi hai woh, if he is such a strong contender. Sometimes, you know, selection meetings can be quite interesting, and the discussions that happen in them can be very interesting," Nayar said on Star Sports.PollDo you agree with the exclusion of Shreyas Iyer from the Asia Cup squad?Yes, it was the right decision.No, he should have been included."But I can't fathom, and I don't understand, what reason can justify Shreyas Iyer not being part of that 20-member squad. I'm not even talking about the 15, I'm talking about the 20-member squad, which sends a message to Shreyas Iyer that he is not in the team's scheme of things. Because even if things don't work out, he is still not coming into the team. Either Riyan Parag is going to make the cut, or someone else is," he added."So, the big question here is that maybe they are not looking at him from a T20 point of view — or perhaps any other point of view. But I always say this that any selection after a while is, 'who you like a little more than the other'. In that regard, maybe Shreyas Iyer is not liked as much as someone else. Maybe."Chief selector Ajit Agarkar, meanwhile, addressed the calls regarding Iyer and Yashasvi Jaiswal."With regards to Shreyas, there's no fault of his — nor is it ours. It's just that we can only pick 15, and at the moment, he might have to wait for his chance," Agarkar explained."With regards to Yashasvi Jaiswal, it's just unfortunate again. Abhishek Sharma, with what he has done over the last few months — or a year or so that he has been with the team — plus the fact that he can bowl a little, gives us an option if required by the captain. One of these guys was always going to miss out. It's just unfortunate that Yashasvi might have to wait for his chance."Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

Dhanashree Verma breaks silence on divorce; calls out Yuzvendra Chahal
Dhanashree Verma has addressed her divorce from Yuzvendra Chahal, expressing her sadness and criticising his choice of attire at the hearing. Chahal's t-shirt, bearing the words “Be your own sugar daddy”, sparked controversy and social media backlash. Dhanashree revealed her emotional breakdown during the verdict and how the incident ultimately motivated her to move on.
Dhanashree Verma breaks silence on divorce; calls Yuzvendra Chahal’s ‘sugar daddy’ t-shirt a stunt: ‘It was painful’ | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsDhanashree Verma breaks silence on divorce; calls Yuzvendra Chahal’s ‘sugar daddy’ t-shirt a stunt: ‘It was painful’TrendingHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarDhanashree Verma breaks silence on divorce; calls Yuzvendra Chahal’s ‘sugar daddy’ t-shirt a stunt: ‘It was painful’TOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 20, 2025, 09:10 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeDhanashree Verma has addressed her divorce from Yuzvendra Chahal, expressing her sadness and criticising his choice of attire at the hearing. Chahal's t-shirt, bearing the words “Be your own sugar daddy”, sparked controversy and social media backlash. Dhanashree revealed her emotional breakdown during the verdict and how the incident ultimately motivated her to move on. Dhanashree Verma and Yuzvendra Chahal  Yuzvendra Chahal's estranged wife, Dhanashree Verma, has finally spoken about her divorce and slammed the Indian cricketer for his attire at the divorce hearing.Chahal appeared wearing a black t-shirt with the words “Be your own sugar daddy”. The move triggered a storm on social media, with many interpreting it as a subtle dig at Dhanashree.Yuzvendra Chahal Explains His Viral 'Be Your Own Sugar Daddy' T‑ShirtGo Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!“Divorce is not something to celebrate. It’s not a celebration; it’s something very sad and deeply emotional. People must not forget that it’s not just about the two individuals, but also about the families involved—those who genuinely love and care about you,” she said on the podcast Spill The Tea.“I also believe true grief and chaos in a marriage have to be understood and acknowledged by both parties. Marriage begins with love, but when it ends, it often ends in distrust. The day it actually happened was very emotional for me, my family, and I’m sure for everyone around us. Even though we were mentally prepared for it, when the verdict was about to be given, I broke down completely. I started howling in front of everyone,” she recalled.Mumbai: Cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal wearing a face mask to hide his face arrives for the hearing of his divorce with wife Dhanashree Verma, at the Bandra Family Court in Mumbai. (PTI Photo)Dhanashree strongly criticised Chahal’s choice of t-shirt on the divorce hearing.“He walked out first, and that whole t-shirt episode unfolded. I wasn’t even aware of it at the time because I was still inside. I left through the back door because I didn’t want to face the media. I was just wearing a simple t-shirt and jeans.PollWhat are your thoughts on Yuzvendra Chahal's choice of attire at the divorce hearing?Inappropriate and disrespectfulA bold statementCompletely fine, it's his choiceI have no opinion on it“I sat in my car, still trying to catch my breath. Before I even realised what had happened, people began speculating about me because of that stunt. Sitting there, I felt like, ‘It’s done. It’s dusted.’“Somewhere, I did feel bad. Why was I even crying about this? Then I thought, forget it—let’s just end this. That moment gave me the motivation to laugh and move on. It’s over,” she added.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. EXPLAINED: Why Shubman Gill got the T20I vice-captaincy over Axar Patel
Shubman Gill has been appointed vice-captain for the Asia Cup 2025 T20I tournament, marking his return to the T20I squad after a two-year absence. Suryakumar Yadav will lead the team, with India set to face UAE and Pakistan in Group A. The Asia Cup serves as crucial preparation for the T20 World Cup in 2026.
Shubman Gill over Axar Patel: The real reason behind India's vice-captaincy shake-up for Asia Cup 2025 | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsShubman Gill over Axar Patel: The real reason behind India's vice-captaincy shake-up for Asia Cup 2025TrendingKagiso RabadaMohammaid KaifSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillAsia CupSalahJasprit BumrahKagiso RabadaMohammaid KaifSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillAsia CupSalahJasprit BumrahKagiso RabadaMohammaid KaifSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillAsia CupSalahJasprit BumrahShubman Gill over Axar Patel: The real reason behind India's vice-captaincy shake-up for Asia Cup 2025TOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 20, 2025, 09:15 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeShubman Gill has been appointed vice-captain for the Asia Cup 2025 T20I tournament, marking his return to the T20I squad after a two-year absence. Suryakumar Yadav will lead the team, with India set to face UAE and Pakistan in Group A. The Asia Cup serves as crucial preparation for the T20 World Cup in 2026. Shubman Gill and Axar Patel  NEW DELHI: India’s Test skipper Shubman Gill has been named vice-captain in India’s 15-member squad for the Asia Cup 2025 T20I tournament, to be held in the UAE from September 9 to 28. The appointment comes more than two years after Gill’s last T20I outing in July 2023, when he had also served as deputy to Suryakumar Yadav.T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav was asked about Gill being chosen ahead of Axar Patel, who had been vice-captain in Gill’s absence.Asia Cup 2025: India Squad Announced | Surya Named Captain, Gill Vice-CaptainGo Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!"The last time he played T20Is for India was when we went to Sri Lanka after the T20 World Cup, not Zimbabwe. I was leading, he was vice-captain, and that's where we started the new cycle for T20 World Cup. After that, he got busy with all the Test series. So, he didn't get the opportunity to play anywhere in T20Is as he got busy playing Test cricket, as well as the Champions Trophy. So, he is there in the squad and they are happy to have him," Suryakumar said at the press conference.Gill’s elevation comes on the back of a promising start as India’s Test captain during the recent series against England.The eight-team Asia Cup will be played in Abu Dhabi and Dubai. Defending champions India are drawn in Group ‘A’ alongside Pakistan, Oman and the UAE.PollDo you agree with Shubman Gill's appointment as vice-captain for the Asia Cup 2025?Yes, he deserves itNo, prefer Axar PatelUnsureOther reasonsIndia will open their campaign against hosts UAE on September 10, before facing arch-rivals Pakistan on September 14 in a marquee clash.Following the Asia Cup, India are scheduled to play 15 more T20Is in the lead-up to the T20 World Cup, which will be jointly hosted by India and Sri Lanka in February 2026.India squad for Asia Cup 2025: Suryakumar Yadav (C), Shubman Gill (VC), Abhishek Sharma, Tilak Varma, Hardik Pandya, Shivam Dube, Axar Patel, Jitesh Sharma (WK), Jasprit Bumrah, Arshdeep Singh, Varun Chakaravarthy, Kuldeep Yadav, Sanju Samson (WK), Harshit Rana, Rinku Singh.Standby players: Prasidh Krishna, Washington Sundar, Dhruv Jurel, Riyan Parag, Yashasvi Jaiswal.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. 'Imran Khan wasn't talented ... used to shout at us': Wasim Akram
Wasim Akram lauded Imran Khan as the greatest captain he played under, highlighting Khan's pivotal role in shaping his career. Akram emphasized that Khan's success stemmed from relentless hard work and determination, exemplified by his willingness to reinvent his bowling action. Imran's leadership instilled confidence in the team, demanding full commitment and intolerance for complacency on the field.
'Imran Khan wasn't talented ... used to shout at us': Wasim Akram spills the beans - WATCH | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket News'Imran Khan wasn't talented ... used to shout at us': Wasim Akram spills the beans - WATCHTrendingAakash ChopraMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementICC ODI RankingsShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarAakash ChopraMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementICC ODI RankingsShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarAakash ChopraMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementICC ODI RankingsShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil Gavaskar'Imran Khan wasn't talented ... used to shout at us': Wasim Akram spills the beans - WATCHTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 20, 2025, 08:40 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeWasim Akram lauded Imran Khan as the greatest captain he played under, highlighting Khan's pivotal role in shaping his career. Akram emphasized that Khan's success stemmed from relentless hard work and determination, exemplified by his willingness to reinvent his bowling action. Imran's leadership instilled confidence in the team, demanding full commitment and intolerance for complacency on the field. Wasim Akram and Imran Khan  NEW DELHI: Pakistan pace legend Wasim Akram has opened up on what it was like to play under Imran Khan, calling the 1992 World Cup-winning skipper the greatest captain he ever played with. Akram, who began his international career in the mid-1980s, credited Imran for shaping him not only as a cricketer but also as a professional.Reflecting on his early days with Pakistan, Akram said much of his development came under Imran’s guidance. Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!"I think whatever I did as a cricketer, off the field, on the field, credit goes to him. He used to give us a lot of confidence. He led from the front. He had a belief in his own ability. He was a hardworking cricketer," Akram said on Stick to Cricket.While many considered Imran a naturally gifted player, Akram stressed that his success was built on relentless effort. "People used to say I'm very naturally talented. Skipper wasn't talented. He worked hard. Remember he changed his bowling action. From 76, exactly. Changing even a little bit of action can take months, it might not happen. But he did change his action. He was so determined," Akram said.Akram emphasised that Imran’s determination and willingness to reinvent himself set an example for the entire team. His hard work, according to Akram, created a culture where no one could afford to be complacent. "I mean he was the best captain I played under. He used to give confidence to every one of us," Akram noted.PollWho do you believe is the greatest cricket captain in history?Imran KhanKapil DevSteve WaughClive LloydAt the same time, Imran was known to be tough on his players when required. Akram explained that the former skipper demanded full commitment on the field. "At times he used to shout at us because if you were lazy, fair enough. He was tough, but he was tough on the field. You give your 100%. If you don’t do well, he was okay with it," he said.However, Imran could not tolerate players who tried to shield themselves in pressure situations. "If you're trying to save yourself and say okay, it's a pressure situation, I’ll just take a back seat — he used to judge. He knew this particular player is just saving himself. So that used to annoy him a lot," Akram revealed.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

Slammed! 'Axar Patel deserves an explanation for removal from vice-captaincy'
Mohammad Kaif has voiced concerns over Axar Patel's removal as T20I vice-captain, replaced by Shubman Gill after a year's absence. Kaif emphasized that Patel deserved prior notification and an explanation for the decision, especially considering his crucial role in India's T20 World Cup 2024 victory. Patel's consistent all-round performance includes 531 runs and 71 wickets in 71 matches.
Asia Cup 2025 | 'Axar Patel deserves an explanation for removal from vice-captaincy': Ex-India star slams decision | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsAsia Cup 2025 | 'Axar Patel deserves an explanation for removal from vice-captaincy': Ex-India star slams decisionTrendingKagiso RabadaMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarKagiso RabadaMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarKagiso RabadaMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarAsia Cup 2025 | 'Axar Patel deserves an explanation for removal from vice-captaincy': Ex-India star slams decisionTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 20, 2025, 06:59 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeMohammad Kaif has voiced concerns over Axar Patel's removal as T20I vice-captain, replaced by Shubman Gill after a year's absence. Kaif emphasized that Patel deserved prior notification and an explanation for the decision, especially considering his crucial role in India's T20 World Cup 2024 victory. Patel's consistent all-round performance includes 531 runs and 71 wickets in 71 matches. Axar Patel (BCCI Photo) NEW DELHI: Former India cricketer and commentator Mohammad Kaif has raised concerns over Axar Patel losing the vice-captaincy of the Indian T20I side, with Shubman Gill taking over the role. Patel, who was named deputy to Suryakumar Yadav for the five-match series against England earlier this year, was replaced following Gill’s return to T20Is after a year-long absence.Taking to social media, Kaif questioned the manner in which the change was handled.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!"I hope Axar Patel was informed about his removal from vice-captaincy in advance and he didn't come to know about it from the press conference. Axar did no wrong so he deserves an explanation," Kaif posted.Patel has cemented his place as a dependable all-rounder across formats, making key contributions in India’s T20 World Cup 2024 triumph. He was named Player of the Match in the semi-final against England for his spell of 3/23.In the final against South Africa, Patel played another pivotal role, scoring 47 off 31 balls when India were reeling at 34/3, and later dismissing Tristan Stubbs to tilt the game in India’s favor.Overall, Patel’s T20I record highlights his consistency — 531 runs at a strike rate of 139.32, along with 71 wickets at an average of 22.12 from 71 matches.India Asia Cup squad press conference: What Ajit Agarkar, Surya said on shocking callsFor the upcoming Asia Cup, India’s selectors have included two other spinners, Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy, in the squad.Among the notable exclusions are Shreyas Iyer and Yashasvi Jaiswal. India will open their Asia Cup campaign against hosts UAE on September 10.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Asia Cup: 'Sanju Samson will sit out' - Former India batter makes bold claim
Aakash Chopra suggests Shubman Gill's inclusion likely sidelines Sanju Samson for the Asia Cup, with selectors prioritizing batting slots. While Agarkar emphasizes the captain and coach will decide the final XI, Suryakumar Yadav praised Jitesh Sharma's growth, potentially favoring him. Samson's place in the playing XI remains uncertain despite his squad inclusion, creating a nervous wait.
Asia Cup: 'Sanju Samson will sit out' - Former India batter makes bold claim | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsAsia Cup: 'Sanju Samson will sit out' - Former India batter makes bold claimTrendingKagiso RabadaMohammaid KaifSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillAsia CupSalahJasprit BumrahKagiso RabadaMohammaid KaifSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillAsia CupSalahJasprit BumrahKagiso RabadaMohammaid KaifSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillAsia CupSalahJasprit BumrahAsia Cup: 'Sanju Samson will sit out' - Former India batter makes bold claimTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 23:04 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAakash Chopra suggests Shubman Gill's inclusion likely sidelines Sanju Samson for the Asia Cup, with selectors prioritizing batting slots. While Agarkar emphasizes the captain and coach will decide the final XI, Suryakumar Yadav praised Jitesh Sharma's growth, potentially favoring him. Samson's place in the playing XI remains uncertain despite his squad inclusion, creating a nervous wait. Sanju Samson (X) Former India batter Aakash Chopra believes Shubman Gill’s return to the side has all but ended Sanju Samson’s chances of finding a place in the playing XI for the Asia Cup in the UAE. “India seems to be moving in the direction of an all-format captain. With Shubman Gill’s return, Sanju Samson’s fate has more or less been sealed. He will not feature in the playing XI now. You will not drop Tilak Varma or Hardik Pandya, which means Samson sits out and Jitesh Sharma will likely get the nod again. One thing is very clear from this selection, the batting slots have been prioritised over personalities. With Gill coming in as vice-captain, he will definitely play and open the batting. This essentially pushes Sanju Samson out of the XI,” Chopra said on JioHotstar.India Asia Cup squad press conference: What Ajit Agarkar, Surya said on shocking callsGo Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW! The announcement of Gill as vice-captain has once again placed a question mark over Samson’s future in T20 internationals. Samson has been included in the squad, but Gill’s return has raised doubts about whether the Kerala batter will make the playing XI. The speculation has grown stronger after chief selector Ajit Agarkar read out the names in a particular order. Gill and Jitesh Sharma were mentioned first, while Samson and Rinku Singh were named towards the end. Many see this as an indication that Gill will open alongside Abhishek Sharma, while Jitesh may take the gloves and bat in the finisher’s role. With Tilak Varma, Suryakumar Yadav, Shivam Dube, Hardik Pandya and Axar Patel expected to fill the middle-order positions, Samson’s opportunities look limited. Jitesh could also be preferred over Rinku Singh as a late-order pinch-hitter. Agarkar, however, played down the debate, saying the final XI would be decided by the captain and coach once the team reaches Dubai. “The captain-coach will take the call on the best balance for the team. Once we get to Dubai, we will have a bit more clarity. With more options available now, Shubman has been in great form for the last few months. So has Sanju, so two good options, along with Abhishek,” Agarkar said.PollWhich player seems most likely to take the gloves in the Asia Cup?Sanju SamsonJitesh Sharma Skipper Suryakumar Yadav added weight to Jitesh Sharma’s case, praising his transformation as a batter over the past year. “Post the last T20 World Cup, we spoke a lot on how to go about it. We said let’s not think of milestones ahead, follow your journey. He has been a completely different cricketer post that. The way he performed in the IPL and domestic tournaments, he has earned his spot again,” Surya said. The captain also defended the selection of pacer Harshit Rana, highlighting his consistency. “He has played really well in the IPL. In Pune, he came in as a concussion replacement and was Man of the Match in the last game he played for India. We back his skills, we know he can deliver,” Surya added. With both the chief selector and captain offering different signals, Samson faces another nervous wait. For now, his inclusion in the squad is not under question, but his place in the XI looks increasingly uncertain.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

'I can't fathom Shreyas Iyer’s exclusion': Former India coach on India’s Asia Cup squad
Former India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar has questioned Shreyas Iyer's exclusion from the Asia Cup squad, despite his strong IPL 2025 performance where he scored 604 runs and led Punjab Kings to the final.
'I can't fathom Shreyas Iyer’s exclusion': Former India coach on India’s Asia Cup squad | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket News'I can't fathom Shreyas Iyer’s exclusion': Former India coach on India’s Asia Cup squadTrendingKagiso RabadaIND Asia Cup Full SquadSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementAsia Cup Indian OpenersAsia Cup Complete SquadAsia CupShreyas IyerJasprit BumrahKagiso RabadaIND Asia Cup Full SquadSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementAsia Cup Indian OpenersAsia Cup Complete SquadAsia CupShreyas IyerJasprit BumrahKagiso RabadaIND Asia Cup Full SquadSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementAsia Cup Indian OpenersAsia Cup Complete SquadAsia CupShreyas IyerJasprit Bumrah'I can't fathom Shreyas Iyer’s exclusion': Former India coach on India’s Asia Cup squadTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 20, 2025, 01:30 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFormer India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar has questioned Shreyas Iyer's exclusion from the Asia Cup squad, despite his strong IPL 2025 performance where he scored 604 runs and led Punjab Kings to the final. Shreyas Iyer of India (Photo by Francois Nel/Getty Images) Former India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar expressed disbelief over the exclusion of Shreyas Iyer from India's Asia Cup squad announced at the BCCI headquarters in Mumbai on Tuesday, while Test captain Shubman Gill secured a spot despite missing recent T20I matches."With regards to Shreyas, not his fault, nor is it ours. It's just that you can pick 15 and at the moment you'll have to wait for his chance," Agarkar told the media.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!"I can't fathom or understand what reason could justify Shreyas Iyer not being part of the 20-member squad. I'm not even talking about the final 15, but the 20 itself, which sends a clear message that Shreyas Iyer is not in the selectors' scheme of things, at least from a T20 perspective," Nayar told JioHotstar.Asia Cup 2025: India Squad Announced | Surya Named Captain, Gill Vice-CaptainTeam India Asia Cup Squad:Surya Kumar Yadav (C), Shubman Gill (VC), Abhishek Sharma, Tilak Varma, Hardik Pandya, Shivam Dube, Axar Patel, Jitesh Sharma (WK), Jasprit Bumrah, Arshdeep Singh, Varun Chakaravarthy, Kuldeep Yadav, Sanju Samson (WK), Harshit Rana, Rinku SinghIyer had demonstrated strong performance in IPL 2025, scoring 604 runs at a strike rate of 175 and leading Punjab Kings to the final in Ahmedabad.The Asia Cup will be held in Dubai and Abu Dhabi from September 9 to 28. The tournament will follow the T20I format and feature eight teams: five full members of the Asian Cricket Council (Afghanistan, Bangladesh, India, Pakistan, and Sri Lanka), along with the UAE, Oman, and Hong Kong.PollDo you agree with the exclusion of Shreyas Iyer from India's Asia Cup squad?Yes, it's unjustifiedNo, it makes senseIndia will kick off their campaign against the UAE on September 10, while the high-voltage game against Pakistan is scheduled for the 14th, with both fixtures set to be played in Dubai. India will play their final group stage fixture against Oman on September 19 in Abu Dhabi.After the group stage, the tournament will proceed to the Super 4, where the top two teams from each group will qualify. If India finishes at the top of Group A, then all of their Super 4 matches will be held in Dubai. If India finishes second, then one of their Super 4 clashes will be held in Abu Dhabi and the remaining two in Dubai. The Super 4 stage will run from September 20 to 26. Dubai will host the final, which is scheduled for September 28.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. 'I would have been surprised if Shubman Gill was not included'
Former cricketer Maninder Singh has praised the balance of India's Asia Cup 2025 squad, while also expressing his surprise at the exclusion of young opener Yashasvi Jaiswal. He welcomed Shubman Gill's selection, highlighting his importance to India's plans. India is set to begin their campaign against the UAE on September 10 in Dubai.

He welcomed Shubman Gill's selection, highlighting his importance to India's plans. India is set to begin their campaign against the UAE on September 10 in Dubai. Shubman Gill (AFP Photo) NEW DELHI: Reacting to India’s squad announcement for the Asia Cup 2025, former India cricketer Maninder Singh lauded the team’s balance but felt that young opener Yashasvi Jaiswal should have been included.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!"It appears to be a balanced team," Maninder said."I think Jaiswal should have been in the team because he is a player who adapts himself to all formats," he added.Asia Cup 2025: India Squad Announced | Surya Named Captain, Gill Vice-CaptainManinder also welcomed Shubman Gill’s selection, stressing that the young captain is central to India’s plans."I would have been surprised if Shubman Gill was not included in the team," he added.PollHow would you rate the overall balance of India's Asia Cup squad?ExcellentGoodAveragePoorIndia will open their campaign against the UAE on September 10, followed by the marquee clash against Pakistan on September 14 in Dubai. Their final group-stage match is scheduled against Oman on September 19 in Abu Dhabi.The tournament will then move into the Super 4 stage, with the top two teams from each group qualifying. If India top Group A, all of their Super 4 fixtures will be played in Dubai. However, if they finish second, one match will be staged in Abu Dhabi and the remaining two in Dubai. The Super 4 stage will be held from September 20 to 26.The final is scheduled for September 28 in Dubai.India squad for Asia Cup 2025:Suryakumar Yadav (C), Shubman Gill (VC), Abhishek Sharma, Tilak Varma, Hardik Pandya, Shivam Dube, Axar Patel, Jitesh Sharma (WK), Jasprit Bumrah, Arshdeep Singh, Varun Chakaravarthy, Kuldeep Yadav, Sanju Samson (WK), Harshit Rana, Rinku Singh.Reserve players: Prasidh Krishna, Washington Sundar, Riyan Parag, Dhruv Jurel, Yashasvi Jaiswal.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

Asia Cup 2025: Why is Rishabh Pant missing from India’s squad?
Rishabh Pant's fractured foot rules him out of the Asia Cup 2025, solidifying Sanju Samson's position as the primary wicketkeeper. Jitesh Sharma has been included as the second option. Pant's recent struggles, including a poor IPL season, further impacted his chances. The final decision on the wicketkeeper will depend on the team's batting strategy.
Asia Cup 2025: Why is Rishabh Pant missing from India’s squad? | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsAsia Cup 2025: Why is Rishabh Pant missing from India’s squad?TrendingKagiso RabadaIND Asia Cup Full SquadSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementAsia Cup Indian OpenersAsia Cup Complete SquadAsia CupShreyas IyerJasprit BumrahKagiso RabadaIND Asia Cup Full SquadSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementAsia Cup Indian OpenersAsia Cup Complete SquadAsia CupShreyas IyerJasprit BumrahKagiso RabadaIND Asia Cup Full SquadSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementAsia Cup Indian OpenersAsia Cup Complete SquadAsia CupShreyas IyerJasprit BumrahAsia Cup 2025: Why is Rishabh Pant missing from India’s squad?TOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 19:05 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeRishabh Pant's fractured foot rules him out of the Asia Cup 2025, solidifying Sanju Samson's position as the primary wicketkeeper. Jitesh Sharma has been included as the second option. Pant's recent struggles, including a poor IPL season, further impacted his chances. The final decision on the wicketkeeper will depend on the team's batting strategy. Rishabh Pant of India (Photo by Gareth Copley/Getty Images) India will head into the Asia Cup 2025 without Rishabh Pant, who has been sidelined with a fractured foot. The wicketkeeper-batsman picked up the injury on the opening day of the fourth Test against England and was forced to return home, missing the fifth Test as well. Pant is now confirmed to miss both the Asia Cup and the upcoming home Test series against West Indies. Even before his injury, Pant was not in India’s immediate T20 plans. Sanju Samson has been the first-choice wicketkeeper in the format, with Pant last featuring in a T20 international against Sri Lanka in July 2024 at Pallekele. His absence has only further cemented Samson’s role behind the stumps, while Jitesh Sharma has been drafted in as the second wicketkeeping option.India Asia Cup squad press conference: What Ajit Agarkar, Surya said on shocking callsGo Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!India's squad for the Asia Cup 2025:Surya Kumar Yadav (C), Shubman Gill (VC), Abhishek Sharma, Tilak Varma, Hardik Pandya, Shivam Dube, Axar Patel, Jitesh Sharma (WK), Jasprit Bumrah, Arshdeep Singh, Varun Chakaravarthy, Kuldeep Yadav, Sanju Samson (WK), Harshit Rana, Rinku Singh Pant’s recent form also did not inspire confidence. He endured a forgettable IPL 2025 campaign, scoring just 269 runs at an average of 24.45 and a strike rate of 133.17. The numbers were heavily boosted by a last-match century against Royal Challengers Bengaluru, with the rest of the season yielding very little for his franchise Lucknow Super Giants.PollWho should be India's first-choice wicketkeeper in T20s?Sanju SamsonJitesh Sharma In the Asia Cup squad, Samson and Jitesh provide contrasting options. While Samson has consistently opened with Abhishek Sharma for India, the return of vice-captain Shubman Gill could push him down the order. If that happens, Jitesh’s power-hitting skills in the middle and lower order could come into play. The final call on who takes the gloves will depend on how the management plans its batting combinations.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Asia Cup: Ex-WC winner surprised at Jaiswal's exclusion - 'Players who make team win ...'
Former Indian cricketer Madan Lal voiced his surprise over Yashasvi Jaiswal's exclusion from India's Asia Cup 2025 squad, led by captain Suryakumar and vice-captain Shubman Gill. Gill's selection comes after a strong performance, while Jaiswal is named as a reserve player despite his impressive IPL 2025 form. India's campaign begins against the UAE on September 10 in Dubai.
Asia Cup: Former World Cup winner surprised at Yashasvi Jaiswal's exclusion - 'Players who make the team win ...' | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsAsia Cup: Former World Cup winner surprised at Yashasvi Jaiswal's exclusion - 'Players who make the team win ...'TrendingKagiso RabadaIND Asia Cup Full SquadSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementAsia Cup Indian OpenersAsia Cup Complete SquadAsia CupShreyas IyerJasprit BumrahKagiso RabadaIND Asia Cup Full SquadSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementAsia Cup Indian OpenersAsia Cup Complete SquadAsia CupShreyas IyerJasprit BumrahKagiso RabadaIND Asia Cup Full SquadSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementAsia Cup Indian OpenersAsia Cup Complete SquadAsia CupShreyas IyerJasprit BumrahAsia Cup: Former World Cup winner surprised at Yashasvi Jaiswal's exclusion - 'Players who make the team win ...'TOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 22:54 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeFormer Indian cricketer Madan Lal voiced his surprise over Yashasvi Jaiswal's exclusion from India's Asia Cup 2025 squad, led by captain Suryakumar and vice-captain Shubman Gill. Gill's selection comes after a strong performance, while Jaiswal is named as a reserve player despite his impressive IPL 2025 form. India's campaign begins against the UAE on September 10 in Dubai. Yashasvi Jaiswal (Agency Photo) Former Indian cricketer Madan Lal expressed surprise at Yashasvi Jaiswal's exclusion from India's 15-member Asia Cup 2025 squad, which was announced on Tuesday.The squad will be led by Suryakumar as captain, with Shubman Gill serving as vice-captain.India Asia Cup squad press conference: What Ajit Agarkar, Surya said on shocking callsIndia's Asia Cup campaign begins against the UAE on September 10 in Dubai. They will face Pa on September 14 in Dubai, followed by their final group stage match against Oman on September 19 in Abu Dhabi.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!"Sometimes you feel surprised that a player like Yashasvi Jaiswal is not in the team. Gill is a good choice as he is performing well. In the coming time, it is possible that Gill will play in all three formats...The players who make the team win a match must not be left out. We have such a good team that we may win the Asia Cup," Madan Lal told ANI.The squad announcement took place during a press conference featuring T20I captain Suryakumar and chief selector Ajit Agarkar, following a selection meeting that included BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia.Gill, who previously captained the T20I tour to Zimbabwe post-T20 World Cup, will participate in his first T20I competition since July 2024 as vice-captain.In his T20I career, Gill has accumulated 578 runs in 21 innings, averaging 30.42 with a strike rate of 139.27. His record includes one century and three fifties, with a highest score of 126 not out.Jaiswal has been designated as a reserve player for the Asia Cup. He previously served as the backup opener to Gill during last year's T20 World Cup, when India opted to open with Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.Jaiswal's T20I statistics include 723 runs in 23 matches, featuring one century and five fifties at a strike rate exceeding 164.His recent IPL 2025 performance, where he scored 559 runs in 14 matches with six fifties at a strike rate of nearly 160, had brought him back into T20I consideration.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. India Asia Cup 2025 squad vs last T20I XI: Changes, inclusions, and omissions
India announce its 15-member squad for the Asia Cup 2025, retaining Suryakumar Yadav as captain and promoting Shubman Gill to vice-captain. The squad sees the return of Jasprit Bumrah and includes fresh faces like Harshit Rana and Jitesh Sharma. While a strong core from the victorious England series remains, notable omissions include Mohammed Shami, Shreyas Iyer and Yashasvi Jaiswal.
India Asia Cup 2025 squad vs last T20I XI: Key changes, inclusions, and omissions | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsIndia Asia Cup 2025 squad vs last T20I XI: Key changes, inclusions, and omissionsTrendingKagiso RabadaIND Asia Cup Full SquadSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementAsia Cup Indian OpenersAsia Cup Complete SquadAsia CupShreyas IyerJasprit BumrahKagiso RabadaIND Asia Cup Full SquadSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementAsia Cup Indian OpenersAsia Cup Complete SquadAsia CupShreyas IyerJasprit BumrahKagiso RabadaIND Asia Cup Full SquadSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementAsia Cup Indian OpenersAsia Cup Complete SquadAsia CupShreyas IyerJasprit BumrahIndia Asia Cup 2025 squad vs last T20I XI: Key changes, inclusions, and omissionsTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 20:32 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeIndia announce its 15-member squad for the Asia Cup 2025, retaining Suryakumar Yadav as captain and promoting Shubman Gill to vice-captain. The squad sees the return of Jasprit Bumrah and includes fresh faces like Harshit Rana and Jitesh Sharma. While a strong core from the victorious England series remains, notable omissions include Mohammed Shami, Shreyas Iyer and Yashasvi Jaiswal. India's squad for ICC Men’s T20 Asia Cup 2025 (PTI Photo)  India’s last T20I outing came against England in February 2025 at the Wankhede Stadium, where Suryakumar Yadav’s men demolished the visitors by 150 runs. The playing XI that day was packed with power-hitters and spin options: Sanju Samson, Abhishek Sharma, Tilak Varma, Suryakumar Yadav, Rinku Singh, Shivam Dube, Hardik Pandya, Axar Patel, Ravi Bishnoi, Mohammed Shami, and Varun Chakravarthy. India’s batting fired spectacularly, with Abhishek smashing 135 off 54 balls and Samson hammering 167 off 122. The bowling unit, led by Shami and Varun, bundled England out for just 97.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!Playing XI back then: Sanju Samson (wk), Abhishek Sharma, Tilak Varma, Suryakumar Yadav (c), Rinku Singh, Shivam Dube, Hardik Pandya, Axar Patel, Ravi Bishnoi, Mohammed Shami, Varun ChakravarthyFast forward to August 19, and the BCCI has named the 15-member squad for the Asia Cup 2025. Suryakumar continues as captain, with Shubman Gill promoted to vice-captain. The squad retains a strong core from the England series: Abhishek, Tilak, Hardik, Dube, Axar, Rinku, Samson, and Varun are all present. However, there are some notable changes. Veteran pacer Mohammed Shami, who starred against England, is missing. Instead, Jasprit Bumrah returns to the T20I setup after workload management kept him out for much of the England tour. Young quick Harshit Rana has also been drafted in, offering fresh pace options alongside Arshdeep Singh.On the spin front, Kuldeep Yadav comes in, strengthening India’s variety, while Bishnoi drops out. The wicketkeeping department sees Samson retained, but Jitesh Sharma is added as a second option, giving the side more flexibility in finishing roles. Shubman Gill, absent from the last T20I, not only returns but takes up leadership responsibility, signalling the selectors’ long-term trust in him. The biggest talking points are the omissions of Shreyas Iyer and Yashasvi Jaiswal, both overlooked despite good domestic and IPL form. Chief selector Ajit Agarkar explained that competition for places, particularly in the middle order, forced tough calls.India squad for Asia Cup 2025: Surya Kumar Yadav (c), Shubman Gill (vc), Abhishek Sharma, Tilak Varma, Hardik Pandya, Shivam Dube, Axar Patel, Jitesh Sharma (WK), Jasprit Bumrah, Arshdeep Singh, Varun Chakaravarthy, Kuldeep Yadav, Sanju Samson (wk), Harshit Rana, Rinku Singh.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Pushing boundaries: How six-hitting changed T20 cricket; India’s surge in the big-hit race
T20 cricket has undergone a six-hitting revolution, transforming batting from risk-averse accumulation to power-driven aggression. India, once lagging behind, now match the world’s best with a six every 12 balls in 2024. With IPL and internationals fuelling the trend, six-hitting is now the currency of modern T20 cricket.
Pushing boundaries: How six-hitting changed T20 cricket; India’s surge in the big-hit race | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsPushing boundaries: How six-hitting changed T20 cricket; India’s surge in the big-hit raceTrendingHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarPushing boundaries: How six-hitting changed T20 cricket; India’s surge in the big-hit raceShubhanshu Dwivedi / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 20, 2025, 13:16 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeT20 cricket has undergone a six-hitting revolution, transforming batting from risk-averse accumulation to power-driven aggression. India, once lagging behind, now match the world’s best with a six every 12 balls in 2024. With IPL and internationals fuelling the trend, six-hitting is now the currency of modern T20 cricket. Abhishek Sharma  (TOI) NEW DELHI: Abhishek Sharma's father Rajkumar Sharma used to get really annoyed while coaching him at the Gandhi Stadium in Amritsar. Sharma says he once got so miffed that he didn’t allow him to bat for a couple of days as punishment. In Delhi, Sanjay Bharadwaj, who has coached the likes of Gautam Gambhir, Amit Mishra, Joginder Sharma, and Unmukt Chand, scolded his NextGen ward Priyansh Arya for always looking to hit glory shots.The two southpaws are still hitting sixes for fun, but their intent forced their respective coaches to change their approach. "Priyansh added that new armoury in my coaching craft. His style of batting forced me to adapt," Bharadwaj told TimesofIndia.com after Priyansh scored a stunning 39-ball century against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) in IPL 2025. Asia Cup 2025: India Squad Announced | Surya Named Captain, Gill Vice-CaptainHitting a six was once a rarity in cricket; coaches often reprimanded players because playing in the ‘V’ was considered the correct way of batting. Today, if you want to find a place in T20 sides as a batter, the ability to clear the boundary at will is non-negotiable.The T20 format has also evolved since its inception almost two decades ago. Earlier, most teams followed the ODI template in T20Is -- exploit the powerplay, save wickets in the middle, and then go all guns blazing in the last five or six overs.But over time, the notion that T20s are just a shorter version of ODIs has been firmly discarded. The format has built its own identity, where hitting sixes and scoring at a higher strike rate form the very foundation of batting.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!With more and more data available, teams realised that scoring quickly is more valuable than preserving wickets at the cost of a slower scoring rate. As a result, line-ups were stacked with power-hitters in the middle order, and players capable of clearing the ropes at will were valued more than accumulators.The six-hitting revolutionConsider this: In 2025, Australia struck 92 sixes in just 8 T20Is, averaging one every 9.5 balls - the second-best six-hitting rate in a calendar year, behind only West Indies’ 157 sixes in 13 matches at 9.2 balls per six in 2023.In 2012, T20 matches saw a six once every 27 deliveries. Since then, the frequency has risen every year, with sixes becoming increasingly common. West Indies were the first big T20 team to crack this code: sixes are the real currency in T20s, the most efficient way to maximise value from each of the 120 deliveries.PollWho do you think is the best power-hitter in T20 cricket today?Abhishek SharmaSuryakumar YadavOther notable playersIn 2016, the T20 World Cup champion West Indies men’s team struck sixes every 16.3 balls against the top seven teams, compared to once every 22.5 balls by other sides in the top eight against each other.In the eight matches they played during the 2015-16 season, the Caribbeans hit 68 sixes in 938 balls faced -- a six every 13.79 deliveries.Where do India’s batters stand? Year / TournamentMatches/InningsBalls FacedSixes HitBalls per SixIndia T20Is 201544641142.18India T20Is 2020101,1626418.15India T20Is 202426287723612.19IPL 20216013,95268720.30IPL 20257316,5141,29412.76 In 2015, Indian batters used to clear the boundary once every 42.18 balls in four T20s -- just 11 sixes from 464 deliveries.But five years later, in 2020, the frequency improved drastically. They struck 64 sixes in 1,162 balls across 10 innings -- one every 18.15 balls.In 2024, the year India dominated world cricket by winning 24 out of 26 matches culminating in their T20 World Cup triumph, their six-hitting touched a whole new level. Across 26 outings, India hit a six every 12.19 balls.IPL stats highlight the same trend. In 2021, out of 13,952 balls faced, batters hit 687 sixes -- one every 20.3 balls.By contrast, IPL 2025 saw 1,294 sixes from 16,514 balls -- a stunning frequency of one every 12.76 balls.The age of power-hittersThe evolution of T20 cricket has been fuelled by the six-hitting revolution. With the arrival of T20 specialists like Abhishek Sharma and Suryakumar Yadav, the art of clearing the ropes has reached unprecedented levels.The fact that 10 wickets are available to be spent in 120 balls changes the dynamics of risk and reward in batting.As a result, batters who are exceptionally good at “hitting” (maximising runs per delivery) have become more valuable than traditional accumulators.We are far from the time when T20s resembled a shortened version of ODIs. The direction is clear: sixes will keep coming more frequently, scores will rise higher, and bowlers will be pushed further to the margins of the format, whether the guardians of cricket like it or not.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Asia Cup: 'Sanju's place is under threat' - Gill's inclusion leaves Samson in an unchartered territory
Shubman Gill's Asia Cup vice-captaincy has ignited debate over Sanju Samson's T20 role, fueled by selection order speculation. R Ashwin criticized the management's decision, fearing Samson's exclusion. Agarkar deferred to the team management for the final XI, acknowledging both Gill and Samson's recent form, leaving Samson's place uncertain despite his performances.
Asia Cup: 'Sanju's place is under threat' - Shubman Gill's inclusion leaves Samson in an unchartered territory | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOITOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsToday's ePaperNewsAsia Cup: 'Sanju's place is under threat' - Shubman Gill's inclusion leaves Samson in an unchartered territoryAsia Cup: 'Sanju's place is under threat' - Shubman Gill's inclusion leaves Samson in an unchartered territoryTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 20, 2025, 13:34 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeShubman Gill's Asia Cup vice-captaincy has ignited debate over Sanju Samson's T20 role, fueled by selection order speculation. R Ashwin criticized the management's decision, fearing Samson's exclusion. Agarkar deferred to the team management for the final XI, acknowledging both Gill and Samson's recent form, leaving Samson's place uncertain despite his performances. Sanju Samson  Shubman Gill's selection as vice-captain for the upcoming Asia Cup in the UAE has sparked discussions about Sanju Samson's position in India's T20 team, despite his inclusion in the squad. The order in which selection committee chairman Ajit Agarkar announced the team has led to speculation about the final playing XI, with Gill possibly opening alongside Abhishek Sharma in India's first match against Oman.Chief selector Ajit Agarkar's announcement sequence, naming Gill and Jitesh Sharma before Samson and Rinku Singh, has fueled speculation about team composition. This has raised questions about Samson's role, despite his recent success as an opener.India Asia Cup squad: Why Shreyas Iyer and Shubman Gill are biggest talking pointsThe batting order appears likely to feature Tilak Varma, Suryakumar Yadav, Shivam Dube, Hardik Pandya, and Axar Patel from positions three to seven. This arrangement leaves limited opportunities for Samson at the top order.Former India spinner R Ashwin has made a scathing attack on Team India's management for picking Shubman Gill in the side."They are thinking of Shubman Gill as the leader for the future. Maybe he can be the all-format captain. But it is not necessary to have the same captain in all formats,” Ashwin said on his YouTube channel "Ash Ki Baat."PollWho do you think should open the batting for India against Oman?Shubman GillAbhishek SharmaBoth of them“What is sadder is that you have announced Gill as the vice-captain, so Sanju Samson's place is also under threat. Sanju is not going to play. Shubman Gill will play, and he will open the batting,” he added. Agarkar addressed the selection matter by deferring to the team management's decision. "The captain-coach will take the call on the best balance for the team. Once we get to Dubai, we will have a bit more clarity. With more options available now, Shubman has been in great form for the last few months. So has Sanju, so two good options, along with Abhishek," he stated.Samson, who captains Rajasthan Royals in the IPL, now faces an uncertain wait before the Asia Cup begins, despite his recent performances.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

Rohit, Kohli disappear from latest ICC ODI Rankings. What happened?
Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli have curiously dropped out of the latest ICC ODI rankings, as Shubman Gill now leads among Indian batters. According to ICC rules, players are removed from rankings if they haven't played within a qualifying period, which is 9-12 months for ODIs.
Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli disappear from latest ICC ODI Rankings. What happened? | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsRohit Sharma, Virat Kohli disappear from latest ICC ODI Rankings. What happened?TrendingAakash ChopraMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementICC ODI RankingsShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarAakash ChopraMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementICC ODI RankingsShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarAakash ChopraMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementICC ODI RankingsShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarRohit Sharma, Virat Kohli disappear from latest ICC ODI Rankings. What happened?TOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 20, 2025, 15:24 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeRohit Sharma and Virat Kohli have curiously dropped out of the latest ICC ODI rankings, as Shubman Gill now leads among Indian batters. According to ICC rules, players are removed from rankings if they haven't played within a qualifying period, which is 9-12 months for ODIs. File photo of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma.  Curiously, neither Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli appear in the latest ODI Rankings, issued by ICC - cricket's global body. In the latest update, August 19, neither of India's ex-captains find a spot in the top-10 rankings.In last week's update, Rohit was in the No. 2 spot with 756 points while Kohli stood in the fourth place with 736 points. Now, Shubman Gill is the leading batter in ODI rankings with 784 rating points and Shreyas Iyer in sixth on 704 points. The other Indian in the top-20 places is KL Rahul in 13th with 638 points.Asia Cup 2025: India Squad Announced | Surya Named Captain, Gill Vice-CaptainIncidentally, Babar Azam, who had slipped to third in last week's rankings with Rohit taking over the second place, has now moved back beneath Gill.Latest ICC ODI Rankings, updated on August 19. (Image: ICC)Neither Rohit or Kohli have played any cricket since IPL 2025 while their last appearance in India's colours came in March in the Champions Trophy final against New Zealand.Do players disappear from the ICC Rankings?Yes. As per ICC's rules on rankings, a player can be removed from the top-100 spots if they've not played a match within the qualifying period - 12-15 months for Tests and 9-12 months for ODIs and T20Is.Alternatively, a player can be removed from the rankings for good if they retire from a format or completely from international cricket. ICC, in its rulebook, explains that when MS Dhoni retired from Tests in 2014, he was removed from the Test rankings, but remained in the ODI rankings.This is why Kohli and Rohit are not presented in the latest Test and T20I rankings considering they've bowed out from both formats. Both retired from the shortest format after winning the 2024 T20 World Cup and from Tests in May this year.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4.
