The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

Asia Cup 2025: Shubman Gill’s elevation a natural progression in India's scheme of things
Shubman Gill's selection as T20 vice-captain for the Asia Cup reflects his consistent IPL performance and leadership qualities, solidifying his place in the squad. His elevation signals a strategic move by the BCCI, potentially positioning him as a future all-format captain and a key figure in Indian cricket's brand identity.
Asia Cup 2025: Shubman Gill’s elevation a natural progression in India's scheme of things | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsAsia Cup 2025: Shubman Gill’s elevation a natural progression in India's scheme of thingsTrendingHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarAsia Cup 2025: Shubman Gill’s elevation a natural progression in India's scheme of thingsK Shriniwas Rao / TNN / Updated: Aug 20, 2025, 12:18 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeShubman Gill's selection as T20 vice-captain for the Asia Cup reflects his consistent IPL performance and leadership qualities, solidifying his place in the squad. His elevation signals a strategic move by the BCCI, potentially positioning him as a future all-format captain and a key figure in Indian cricket's brand identity. Shubman Gill (PTI Photo)  The selection of Shubman Gill as vice-captain of India’s T20 team for the Asia Cup is neither a surprise nor out of place.Barring the 2024 edition of the Indian Premier League (IPL), when he didn’t play his full quota of matches and finished 12th among the top-scorers that year, Gill has either topped the batting charts in the T20 league in the remaining seasons over the last five years or has managed to figure in the top five. In fact, when he top scored in the 2023 edition with 870 runs, it was only second to the most number of runs ever scored by a batter in the IPL — 973 runs in 2016 by Virat Kohli. It was Gill’s season with the bat and the rest were merely spectators soaking it all in.India Asia Cup squad: Why Shreyas Iyer and Shubman Gill are biggest talking pointsThe kind of aggression, consistency, approach and leadership that Gill has managed to show in the last few years of the IPL — the single-biggest platform that allows the selectors to do their T20 math before putting together a good team — didn’t leave Ajit Agarkar and his team with much of a choice but to bring him in. In a squad of 15, there was no chance of leaving the man aside.But then there are those who might ask, why the vice-captaincy? Has Gill done enough to slip into the leadership role in the shortest format, or is it a natural extension of the role he’s acquired in Test cricket, where BCCI’s possibly indicating that he could be India’s future all-format captain? Is Gill set to follow MS Dhoni, Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma and be the fourth in line very soon?23 years and 146 days23 years and 146 days - Shubman Gill's age when he scored his only T20I hundred, against New Zealand in Ahmedabad on February 1, 2023, making him the youngest Indian to score hundreds in all three formats in international cricket.Well, now that we’ve concluded that his selection in the team is by no degree an unwarranted one, let’s move on to understanding why his elevation as vice-captain in not unwarranted either.Shubman Gill in IPL over the yearsYearMatNoRunsHSAvgBFSR10050Career11817386612939.452787138.72426202515265093*50.00417155.8806202412142610438.73289147.4012202317289012959.33564157.803420221624839634.50365132.330420211704785728.11402118.9003202014144070*33.84373117.960320191442967632.88238124.3603201813520357*33.83139146.0401As much as the sport derives traction from the field, there’s a lot that happens off it also that keeps the Indian cricket ticking — revenues, broadcast, sponsorships, fan engagement and more. Every now and then, when broadcast rights or sponsorship slots go on sale, the cricket board ends up burning the midnight oil trying to figure the right value.In any kind of value creation, only brand and consistency matter. From the days of Sachin Tendulkar, Sourav Ganguly and Rahul Dravid, to 2007 when India struck the T20 goldmine and MS Dhoni emerged, to 2015 onwards, when Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma singlehandedly moved the brand needle in Indian cricket to the next level — there’s always been a face that Indian cricket could identify with.PollWill Shubman Gill become the future all-format captain of India?DefinitelyPossiblyUnlikelyIn 2024, ‘who next?’ was the question that began to pop up inside BCCI boardrooms. It is in search of this space that the cricket board began identifying Shubman Gill. It wasn’t some random out-of-the-blue selection hunch that elevated him to Test captaincy earlier this year. It isn’t some random selection hunch that’s elevated him to T20 captaincy either.Tuesday’s selection had a massive future connotation to it.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. 'Game must go on': Wasim Akram's blunt take on IND vs PAK match in Asia Cup
Pakistani cricket legend Wasim Akram emphasizes that the Asia Cup 2025 should proceed regardless of India's participation against Pakistan. Scheduled in Dubai and Abu Dhabi from September 9-28, the tournament features eight teams. Akram voices optimism for a future India-Pakistan Test series, advocating for focusing on sporting achievements and avoiding political tensions.
'Game must go on': Wasim Akram's blunt take on India vs Pakistan match in Asia Cup | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket News'Game must go on': Wasim Akram's blunt take on India vs Pakistan match in Asia CupTrendingHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil Gavaskar'Game must go on': Wasim Akram's blunt take on India vs Pakistan match in Asia CupTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 20, 2025, 12:27 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargePakistani cricket legend Wasim Akram emphasizes that the Asia Cup 2025 should proceed regardless of India's participation against Pakistan. Scheduled in Dubai and Abu Dhabi from September 9-28, the tournament features eight teams. Akram voices optimism for a future India-Pakistan Test series, advocating for focusing on sporting achievements and avoiding political tensions. MANCHESTER, ENGLAND - JULY 25: Ex Lancashire and Pakistan player Wasim Akram rings the bell ahead of Day Three of the 4th Rothesay Test Match between England and India at Emirates Old Trafford on July 25, 2025 in Manchester, England. (Photo by Clive Mason/Getty Images) Legendary Pakistan fast bowler Wasim Akram has opined that whether India play Pakistan in the Asia Cup 2025 or not, "the game must go on."The Asia Cup will be hosted in Dubai and Abu Dhabi from September 9 to 28, featuring eight teams divided into two groups. Group A comprises India, Pakistan, UAE, and Oman, while Group B includes Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, Afghanistan, and Hong Kong.India Asia Cup squad press conference: What Ajit Agarkar, Surya said on shocking callsAlthough India is the official tournament host, matches will be played at neutral venues for three years when competitions are held in India or Pakistan, as per an agreement between the BCCI and PCB.Dubai will host 11 matches, while Abu Dhabi will stage eight fixtures. The tournament opens with Afghanistan facing Hong Kong on September 9 in Abu Dhabi.India begins their campaign against the UAE on September 10 in Dubai, followed by a highly anticipated match against Pakistan on September 14, also in Dubai. Their final group-stage match against Oman is scheduled for September 19 in Abu Dhabi.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!The Super 4 stage will feature the top two teams from each group. If India tops Group A, all their Super 4 matches will be played in Dubai. However, if they finish second, one match will be in Abu Dhabi and two in Dubai.The Super 4 stage runs from September 20 to 26, with the final scheduled for September 28 in Dubai.PollDo you think the Asia Cup 2025 should proceed regardless of India-Pakistan matchups?Yes, the game must go on.No, it's not the same without the rivalry."Asia Cup schedule is out, there is backlash. But we in Pakistan are calm. We will be fine whether we play or don’t play. The game must go on," Akram said on the Stick With Cricket Podcast.Akram is also hopeful that there will be a Test series between India and Pakistan in the near future."I hope to see a Test series between India and Pakistan in my lifetime," he said."Politics apart, I am not a politician. They are patriotic about their country, we are patriotic about ours. Let's not go below the belt. Talk about the triumphs of your country; the same goes for Pakistan and the same goes for India."It is easier said than done."Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Watch Here!About the AuthorTOI Sports DeskThe TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide. 

From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects. 

We deliver accurate, engaging, and up-to-the-minute sports content, round the clock.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   Previous9 simple tips to lower blood pressure naturallyLifestyleIn pics: Adorable looks of Chandhini PrakashtvZodiac signs that feel loneliness the mostastrologyLife lessons to learn from Samantha Ruth PrabhuEntertainmentNayanthara’s transformation: Glowing brighter with timeEntertainmentTop 5 zodiac signs who are truly spiritual soulsastrologyVerdict of Rajinikanth's last 10 films before 'Coolie'EntertainmentIn pics: Stunning looks of Subhashree GangulytvSaiee Manjrekar looks radiant in different stylesEntertainmentChahatt Khanna’s Striking Style Statementstv Next123Top Sports NewsKylian MbappeR AshwinShafali VarmaIND vs PAK MatchPrithvi ShawShubman GillTop TrendingFree Doctor Strange Skin in Marvel RivalsJean PormanoveAndy RoddickJustin HerbertConnor McDavidPatrick MahomesDesmond WatsonTom BradyNHL Trade NewsTaylor SwiftTired of too many ads?go ad free nowTrending StoriesIn SportsEntire WebsiteAsia Cup 2025: Shubman Gill’s elevation a natural progression in India's scheme of things'Game must go on': Wasim Akram's blunt take on IND vs PAK match in Asia CupAsia Cup: R Ashwin's shocking admission - 'I am happy for Shubman, but...'Asia Cup: Harbhajan Singh blasts Ajit Agarkar - 'I had hoped...''Shreyas is not liked as much as ... Asia Cup: R Ashwin's shocking admission - 'I am happy for Shubman, but...'
R Ashwin expressed surprise at the exclusion of Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shreyas Iyer from India's Asia Cup squad, led by Suryakumar Yadav. While acknowledging Shubman Gill's selection due to his IPL performance and Test series success, Ashwin voiced concern for Jaiswal and Iyer, hoping they received explanations for their omission, especially with the T20 World Cup on the horizon.
Asia Cup 2025: R Ashwin's shocking admission - 'I am happy for Shubman, but...' | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsAsia Cup 2025: R Ashwin's shocking admission - 'I am happy for Shubman, but...'TrendingHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarAsia Cup 2025: R Ashwin's shocking admission - 'I am happy for Shubman, but...'TOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 20, 2025, 12:30 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeR Ashwin expressed surprise at the exclusion of Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shreyas Iyer from India's Asia Cup squad, led by Suryakumar Yadav. While acknowledging Shubman Gill's selection due to his IPL performance and Test series success, Ashwin voiced concern for Jaiswal and Iyer, hoping they received explanations for their omission, especially with the T20 World Cup on the horizon. Shreyas Iyer and Yashasvi Jaiswal (X) Former India spinner R Ashwin admitted that he was a bit shocked not to see the names of Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shreyas Iyer in Suryakumar Yadav-led 15-member squad for the Asia Cup.The Asia Cup will begin on September 9, with defending champions India set to face hosts United Arab Emirates a day later in Dubai in the eight-nation tournament. India and arch-rivals Pakistan have been clubbed in Group A and will clash on September 14.India Asia Cup squad: Why Shreyas Iyer and Shubman Gill are biggest talking pointsGo Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!“See, I understand that selection is a thankless job," Ashwin said on his YouTube channel ‘Ash Ki Baat’."Leaving somebody out, telling someone they are dropped, it is not an easy thing. You have to speak to the players, you have to go through the sadness."I just hope Shreyas Iyer and Yashasvi Jaiswal were given a call, and they were told the reasons behind not being picked.“Genuinely, I understand Shubman Gill's selection. He is also the vice-captain. He has scored a lot of runs for the Gujarat Titans in the IPL. He has the credentials to be picked in the T20I setup,” he added.Gill, 25, returned to the 15-man squad as deputy to skipper Suryakumar Yadav, thanks to the stellar role he played with the bat in the recent Test series against England.PollDo you agree with Ashwin's opinion on the exclusion of Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shreyas Iyer from the Asia Cup squad?Yes, it's unfairNo, the selections are justifiedNot sureI don't follow cricket closelyThe top-order batsman scored 754 runs as India's relatively young squad fought from behind to square the five-match series 2-2.The eight-nation Asia Cup will be the first major event in the build-up to next year's T20 World Cup in India in February and March.Gill, who was named Test skipper after the retirement of veterans Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli earlier this year, last played a T20 international in July 2024.“When you have Yashasvi Jaiswal as the third opener in the T20 World Cup 2024, to remove someone from the World Cup squad and bring in Shubman Gill... I mean, it's okay, I am happy for Shubman, but I'm very sad for both Yashasvi Jaiswal and Shreyas Iyer. It is just not fair to these two kids,” said Ashwin.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

Asia Cup: Harbhajan Singh blasts Ajit Agarkar - 'I had hoped...'
Harbhajan Singh has criticized Ajit Agarkar's selection choices for India's Asia Cup squad, questioning the exclusion of Mohammed Siraj and Shreyas Iyer. Singh believes Siraj's 'X-factor' and Iyer's good form could have strengthened the team. The Asia Cup is set to begin on September 9, with India facing the United Arab Emirates.
Asia Cup: Harbhajan Singh blasts Ajit Agarkar for not picking two ‘X-factor’ cricketers - 'I had hoped...' | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsAsia Cup: Harbhajan Singh blasts Ajit Agarkar for not picking two ‘X-factor’ cricketers - 'I had hoped...'TrendingHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramUS Open 2025India Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramUS Open 2025India Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramUS Open 2025India Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarAsia Cup: Harbhajan Singh blasts Ajit Agarkar for not picking two ‘X-factor’ cricketers - 'I had hoped...'TOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 20, 2025, 10:10 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeHarbhajan Singh has criticized Ajit Agarkar's selection choices for India's Asia Cup squad, questioning the exclusion of Mohammed Siraj and Shreyas Iyer. Singh believes Siraj's 'X-factor' and Iyer's good form could have strengthened the team. The Asia Cup is set to begin on September 9, with India facing the United Arab Emirates. Indian Mens T20 Captain Suryakumar Yadav, left, and Chief Selector Ajit Agarkar during the press conference to announce the team for the Cricket Asia Cup 2025 at the BCCI Headquarters in Mumbai, India, Tuesday, Aug. 19, 2025. (AP Photo/Rajanish Kakade) Former India spinner Harbhajan Singh lambasted chairman of selectors Ajit Agarkar for leaving out two “X-factor” players from India’s 15-member squad for the Asia Cup.“I feel that Siraj’s name should have been included as well. Siraj bowled very well in the recent series," Harbhajan said on his YouTube channel.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!"Yes, he bowled a lot in England, but he also got adequate rest. So he could have been included."If he had been picked, the team would have looked even stronger. The bowling unit would have seemed stronger. I feel that the ‘X-factor’ Siraj brings might be somewhat missed," he added.Another omission that surprised Harbhajan was the absence of Shreyas Iyer from the squad.“I had hoped he (Shreyas Iyer) would get a place in the team. He scored a lot of runs, played in the IPL final, and was in very good form."I thought his name could have been there. As for whose spot he would take, that is for the selectors to decide."When someone has to be included or left out, a spot is made. But I did not see Shreyas Iyer’s name there, which surprised me a little," he added.The Asia Cup will begin on September 9, with defending champions India set to face hosts United Arab Emirates a day later in Dubai in the eight-nation tournament.PollIs Shreyas Iyer's exclusion from the squad surprising?Absolutely surprisingNot surprising at allSomewhat surprisingI don't follow the team closelyIndia and arch-rivals Pakistan have been placed in Group A and will clash on September 14.Pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah has also made a comeback to the T20 squad after skipping two matches in England to manage his workload.Bumrah’s last T20 outing was India’s World Cup title win over South Africa at Barbados in June 2024.With Kohli and Rohit retiring from T20 internationals after that triumph, Bumrah will lead the pace attack alongside left-arm quick Arshdeep Singh and Harshit Rana. Axar Patel, Varun Chakravarthy, and Kuldeep Yadav will handle the spin department.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics.

'Shreyas Iyer will be part of the team': Ex-cricketer explains how
Aakash Chopra has voiced his surprise over Shreyas Iyer's exclusion from the Asia Cup reserve players list, despite Iyer's impressive IPL 2025 performance where he scored 604 runs and led Punjab Kings to the final. Chopra believes this omission sends a negative signal regarding Iyer's T20I future.
Asia Cup | 'Shreyas Iyer will be part of the team': Ex-cricketer explains how | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsAsia Cup | 'Shreyas Iyer will be part of the team': Ex-cricketer explains howTrendingAakash ChopraMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarAakash ChopraMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarAakash ChopraMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarAsia Cup | 'Shreyas Iyer will be part of the team': Ex-cricketer explains howTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 20, 2025, 13:14 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAakash Chopra has voiced his surprise over Shreyas Iyer's exclusion from the Asia Cup reserve players list, despite Iyer's impressive IPL 2025 performance where he scored 604 runs and led Punjab Kings to the final. Chopra believes this omission sends a negative signal regarding Iyer's T20I future. Shreyas Iyer (Image credit: ICC Photo) NEW DELHI: Former India opener Aakash Chopra has expressed surprise at Shreyas Iyer’s exclusion from the reserve players list for the upcoming Asia Cup, pointing out that it doesn’t send the right message regarding his T20I future.Iyer, who piled up 604 runs at a strike rate of 175 in IPL 2025 while leading Punjab Kings to the runners-up spot, had shown marked improvement against the short ball and dominated spinners throughout the tournament. Yet, he found no place in either the 15-member squad for the Asia Cup or the five-man reserves list.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!The omission had earlier baffled former India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar, and now Chopra has voiced similar concerns. "Shreyas' name is not even there in the five reserves, and that is surprising. It's understandable that you couldn't have him in the 15 as you can't play him in the XI, and you wanted lower-order batters as backup, where Shivam Dube is there, and Rinku Singh will be given another chance, which is absolutely par for the course."However, a place could have been created in the reserve players at least, where you have kept Dhruv Jurel, Yashasvi Jaiswal and Prasidh Krishna. Shreyas’ name could have been there, but you haven't kept it there either, and that doesn't send a great signal. The clarity in front of Shreyas' name is completely not there," Chopra said on his YouTube channel on Wednesday.At the same time, Chopra believes Iyer’s international future is far from over and that he still has a pathway to the 2026 Men’s T20 World Cup if he maintains strong performances in ODIs. For now, Iyer’s immediate focus will be on representing West Zone in the Duleep Trophy, which marks the start of the 2025/26 domestic season.India Asia Cup squad: Why Shreyas Iyer and Shubman Gill are biggest talking points"Shreyas Iyer not being there is a big story. What more will Shreyas Iyer have to do? What more can you do than what you have already done? You had a 600-plus run IPL season, took the team to the final, scored runs in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy, played Ranji, and won the Champions Trophy. That's all you can do as a human being."This is the Asia Cup team. Don't attach the World Cup with it because there are 15 T20Is after this. The world changes in 15 T20Is. If he keeps scoring runs in ODIs, sooner or later, Shreyas Iyer will be part of the team. I have a strong feeling that Shreyas Iyer will be a part of India's T20 World Cup team," he added.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. 'Shreyas is not liked as much as ... ': Ex-India coach blasts Gambhir and Agarkar
Shreyas Iyer's exclusion from both the Asia Cup squad and standby list has sparked controversy, despite his impressive IPL 2025 performance. Former assistant coach Abhishek Nayar questioned the decision, emphasizing Iyer's strong contention. Chief selector Ajit Agarkar acknowledged the difficulty of the decision, citing limited squad space.
Asia Cup | 'Shreyas Iyer is not liked as much as ... ': Ex-India coach blasts Gautam Gambhir and selector Ajit Agarkar - WATCH | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsAsia Cup | 'Shreyas Iyer is not liked as much as ... ': Ex-India coach blasts Gautam Gambhir and selector Ajit Agarkar - WATCHTrendingHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarAsia Cup | 'Shreyas Iyer is not liked as much as ... ': Ex-India coach blasts Gautam Gambhir and selector Ajit Agarkar - WATCHTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 20, 2025, 11:26 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeShreyas Iyer's exclusion from both the Asia Cup squad and standby list has sparked controversy, despite his impressive IPL 2025 performance. Former assistant coach Abhishek Nayar questioned the decision, emphasizing Iyer's strong contention. Chief selector Ajit Agarkar acknowledged the difficulty of the decision, citing limited squad space. Shreyas Iyer (AP Photo) NEW DELHI: India’s cricket selectors sprung a surprise by leaving out Shreyas Iyer from both the 15-member Asia Cup squad and the five standby players, despite his strong showings in the Champions Trophy and IPL 2025. The announcement was made by BCCI chief selector Ajit Agarkar and T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav on Tuesday.Iyer enjoyed an excellent IPL season, guiding Punjab Kings to the final while amassing 604 runs in 17 matches at a strike rate of 175.07. He finished as the sixth-highest run-scorer of the tournament.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!Former India assistant coach Abhishek Nayar voiced his disappointment at Iyer’s exclusion."I don't know, actually, I wanted to ask that question — aapke reserve players mein kaise nahi hai woh, if he is such a strong contender. Sometimes, you know, selection meetings can be quite interesting, and the discussions that happen in them can be very interesting," Nayar said on Star Sports.PollDo you agree with the exclusion of Shreyas Iyer from the Asia Cup squad?Yes, it was the right decision.No, he should have been included."But I can't fathom, and I don't understand, what reason can justify Shreyas Iyer not being part of that 20-member squad. I'm not even talking about the 15, I'm talking about the 20-member squad, which sends a message to Shreyas Iyer that he is not in the team's scheme of things. Because even if things don't work out, he is still not coming into the team. Either Riyan Parag is going to make the cut, or someone else is," he added."So, the big question here is that maybe they are not looking at him from a T20 point of view — or perhaps any other point of view. But I always say this that any selection after a while is, 'who you like a little more than the other'. In that regard, maybe Shreyas Iyer is not liked as much as someone else. Maybe."Chief selector Ajit Agarkar, meanwhile, addressed the calls regarding Iyer and Yashasvi Jaiswal."With regards to Shreyas, there's no fault of his — nor is it ours. It's just that we can only pick 15, and at the moment, he might have to wait for his chance," Agarkar explained."With regards to Yashasvi Jaiswal, it's just unfortunate again. Abhishek Sharma, with what he has done over the last few months — or a year or so that he has been with the team — plus the fact that he can bowl a little, gives us an option if required by the captain. One of these guys was always going to miss out. It's just unfortunate that Yashasvi might have to wait for his chance."Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics.

'Security in India better than Pakistan': Hockey official on PAK, Oman pulling out of Asia Cup
Pakistan and Oman have withdrawn from the Hockey Asia Cup 2025 in India, citing security concerns, a claim dismissed by Indian officials. The tournament, crucial for 2026 World Cup qualification, will proceed with eight teams. India's hockey officials emphasize that security arrangements are robust and are focused on hosting a successful event despite the withdrawals.
'Security in India is much better than in Pakistan': Hockey official on PAK, Oman pulling out of Asia Cup hockey | Hockey News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOITOI GamesLive VideosCityMetro CitiesmumbaidelhibengaluruHyderabadkolkatachennaiOther CitiesCityagraagartalaahmedabadajmeramaravatiamritsarbareillybhubaneswarbhopalchandigarhchhatrapati sambhajinagarcoimbatorecuttackdehradunerodefaridabadghaziabadgoagurgaonguwahatihubballiimphalindoreitanagarjaipurjammujamshedpurjodhpurkanpurkochikohimakolhapurkozhikodeludhianalucknowmaduraimangalurumeerutmumbai regionmysurunagpurnashiknavi mumbainoidapatnaprayagrajpuducherrypuneraipurrajkotranchithanesalemshillongshimlasrinagarsurattrichythiruvananthapuramudaipurvadodaravaranasivijayawadavisakhapatnamphotosWeb StoriesIndiafeaturedOperation SindoorCancel PatriarchyMaharashtraDelhiKarnatakaTamil NaduTelanganaUttar PradeshWest BengalGujaratMadhya PradeshBiharChandigarhRajasthanArunachal PradeshAndhra PradeshAssamChhattisgarhGoaHaryanaHimachal PradeshJammu KashmirJharkhandKeralaManipurMeghalayaMizoramNagalandOdishaPunjabSikkimTripuraUttarakhandAndaman Nicobar IslandsDadra Nagar HaveliDaman DiuLakshadweepPondicherryWeb StoriesSaving Our StripesDigital ArrestWorldBusinessTechCricketSportsEntertainmentAstroTVEducationLife & StyleWeb SeriesTimes EvokePhotosBlogsToday's ePaperNews'Security in India is much better than in Pakistan': Hockey official on PAK, Oman pulling out of Asia Cup hockey'Security in India is much better than in Pakistan': Hockey official on PAK, Oman pulling out of Asia Cup hockeyTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 20, 2025, 11:08 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargePakistan and Oman have withdrawn from the Hockey Asia Cup 2025 in India, citing security concerns, a claim dismissed by Indian officials. The tournament, crucial for 2026 World Cup qualification, will proceed with eight teams. India's hockey officials emphasize that security arrangements are robust and are focused on hosting a successful event despite the withdrawals. Pakistan hockey team (Image credit: X) Pakistan and Oman have withdrawn from the upcoming Hockey Asia Cup 2025, citing security concerns. The tournament, scheduled from August 29 to September 7 in Rajgir, Bihar, has sparked reactions from Indian hockey officials who have dismissed these security worries. The winner of this prestigious continental championship will secure a spot in the 2026 FIH Hockey World Cup.Hockey India Secretary General Bhola Nath Singh questioned Pakistan's decision to pull out. "Why isn't Pakistan coming? Why are they not participating? This is not clear to us," Singh said. He firmly stated that "security and all the arrangements in India are much better than in Pakistan."Former India hockey captain and Congress MLA Pargat Singh also rejected the security concerns. "There is no such issue in India, I don't think there is any such problem in our country," he said. He pointed out that Pakistan's behaviour was disappointing from a sporting perspective.Pargat Singh also commented on Pakistan's declining hockey standards. He noted that internal disturbances had affected Pakistan's once-strong hockey program, saying "Pakistan Hockey was good once but if there are internal disturbances, everything gets affected."Despite the withdrawals, organisers remain focused on hosting a successful event. As Bhola Nath Singh emphasised, "For us, we have to organise this as a grand success, and whoever is coming, we welcome them wholeheartedly."The tournament will feature eight teams divided into two pools. Pool A includes host India, Japan, China, and Kazakhstan, while Pool B comprises Malaysia, Korea, Bangladesh, and Chinese Taipei. The opening day will see defending champions Korea face Chinese Taipei, while India will take on China.India's campaign begins against China, followed by matches against Japan on August 31 and Kazakhstan on September 1. The tournament format includes a Super4s stage, culminating in a final on September 7 between the top two teams.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

Asia Cup: Gavaskar makes a big prediction about Gill's future - 'He could be leading...'
Sunil Gavaskar believes Shubman Gill's impressive form and IPL performance justify his Asia Cup vice-captaincy. Gavaskar suggests this role indicates Gill could lead India's T20 team in the future, praising his ability to handle pressure while leading in England. Regarding Yashasvi Jaiswal's omission, Gavaskar emphasizes supporting the selected team and avoiding unnecessary controversy.
Asia Cup 2025: Sunil Gavaskar makes a big prediction about Shubman Gill's future - 'He could be leading...' | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsAsia Cup 2025: Sunil Gavaskar makes a big prediction about Shubman Gill's future - 'He could be leading...'TrendingHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarAsia Cup 2025: Sunil Gavaskar makes a big prediction about Shubman Gill's future - 'He could be leading...'TOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 20, 2025, 12:29 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeSunil Gavaskar believes Shubman Gill's impressive form and IPL performance justify his Asia Cup vice-captaincy. Gavaskar suggests this role indicates Gill could lead India's T20 team in the future, praising his ability to handle pressure while leading in England. Regarding Yashasvi Jaiswal's omission, Gavaskar emphasizes supporting the selected team and avoiding unnecessary controversy. India captain Shubman Gill speaks during a press conference at Edgbaston, Birmingham, England, Tuesday July 1, 2025. AP/PTI(AP07_01_2025_000278A) Legendary India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar has predicted that Shubman Gill might end up leading the team in T20Is as well, after the 25-year-old was elevated as the team’s vice-captain for the Asia Cup."Not surprising at all. He (Shubman Gill) scored over 750 runs just a couple of weeks ago," Gavaskar told India Today.India Asia Cup squad: Why Shreyas Iyer and Shubman Gill are biggest talking pointsGo Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!"You cannot exclude a player in that kind of form. Also, he has done really well in the IPL, which concluded just before the tour to England."It's a very good inclusion. Giving him the vice-captaincy is also a way of telling him that in the future, he could be leading the T20 side. I think it’s a very, very good selection," he added."He was very impressive in England. To score 750-plus runs while leading the side for the first time shows how well he handled pressure."This vice-captaincy is a clear sign that he is going to be the captain of the Indian team as well. It's always good to have him take responsibility just a little bit earlier,” Gavaskar said.Gavaskar also refused to comment on Yashasvi Jaiswal's omission from the squad.PollHow do you rate Shubman Gill's performance in recent matches?OutstandingGoodAveragePoor"You can only pick XI in the match and you can only pick 15 in the squad. Somebody has to miss out; that's just how it is in Indian cricket," he said."No point in discussing whether A or B or C should've been there. This is now our team. We can all have our opinions before the selection committee picks the team, but once the team is picked, we should back it fully."We shouldn't be saying A should've been there or B should've been there. That only creates controversy, which the players don't need."Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Watch Here!About the AuthorTOI Sports DeskThe TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide. 

From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects. 

We deliver accurate, engaging, and up-to-the-minute sports content, round the clock.Read MoreEnd of ArticleFollow Us On Social Media Visual Stories   PreviousHow to use Kumkumadi Tailam to get that everlasting glow on the faceLifestyle9 simple tips to lower blood pressure naturallyLifestyleIn pics: Adorable looks of Chandhini PrakashtvZodiac signs that feel loneliness the mostastrologyLife lessons to learn from Samantha Ruth PrabhuEntertainmentNayanthara’s transformation: Glowing brighter with timeEntertainmentTop 5 zodiac signs who are truly spiritual soulsastrologyVerdict of Rajinikanth's last 10 films before 'Coolie'EntertainmentIn pics: Stunning looks of Subhashree GangulytvSaiee Manjrekar looks radiant in different stylesEntertainment Next123Top Sports NewsKylian MbappeR AshwinShafali VarmaIND vs PAK MatchPrithvi ShawShubman GillTop TrendingFree Doctor Strange Skin in Marvel RivalsJean PormanoveAndy RoddickJustin HerbertConnor McDavidPatrick MahomesDesmond WatsonTom BradyNHL Trade NewsTaylor SwiftTired of too many ads?go ad free nowTrending StoriesIn SportsEntire WebsiteAsia Cup 2025: Shubman Gill’s elevation a natural progression in India's scheme of things'Game must go on': Wasim Akram's blunt take on IND vs PAK match in Asia CupAsia Cup: R Ashwin's shocking admission - 'I am happy for Shubman, but...'Asia Cup: Harbhajan Singh blasts Ajit Agarkar - 'I had hoped...''Shreyas is not liked as much as ... Dhanashree Verma breaks silence on divorce; calls out Yuzvendra Chahal
Dhanashree Verma has addressed her divorce from Yuzvendra Chahal, expressing her sadness and criticising his choice of attire at the hearing. Chahal's t-shirt, bearing the words “Be your own sugar daddy”, sparked controversy and social media backlash. Dhanashree revealed her emotional breakdown during the verdict and how the incident ultimately motivated her to move on.
Dhanashree Verma breaks silence on divorce; calls Yuzvendra Chahal’s ‘sugar daddy’ t-shirt a stunt: ‘It was painful’ | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket NewsDhanashree Verma breaks silence on divorce; calls Yuzvendra Chahal’s ‘sugar daddy’ t-shirt a stunt: ‘It was painful’TrendingHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarDhanashree Verma breaks silence on divorce; calls Yuzvendra Chahal’s ‘sugar daddy’ t-shirt a stunt: ‘It was painful’TOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 20, 2025, 09:10 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeDhanashree Verma has addressed her divorce from Yuzvendra Chahal, expressing her sadness and criticising his choice of attire at the hearing. Chahal's t-shirt, bearing the words “Be your own sugar daddy”, sparked controversy and social media backlash. Dhanashree revealed her emotional breakdown during the verdict and how the incident ultimately motivated her to move on. Dhanashree Verma and Yuzvendra Chahal  Yuzvendra Chahal's estranged wife, Dhanashree Verma, has finally spoken about her divorce and slammed the Indian cricketer for his attire at the divorce hearing.Chahal appeared wearing a black t-shirt with the words “Be your own sugar daddy”. The move triggered a storm on social media, with many interpreting it as a subtle dig at Dhanashree.Yuzvendra Chahal Explains His Viral 'Be Your Own Sugar Daddy' T‑ShirtGo Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!“Divorce is not something to celebrate. It’s not a celebration; it’s something very sad and deeply emotional. People must not forget that it’s not just about the two individuals, but also about the families involved—those who genuinely love and care about you,” she said on the podcast Spill The Tea.“I also believe true grief and chaos in a marriage have to be understood and acknowledged by both parties. Marriage begins with love, but when it ends, it often ends in distrust. The day it actually happened was very emotional for me, my family, and I’m sure for everyone around us. Even though we were mentally prepared for it, when the verdict was about to be given, I broke down completely. I started howling in front of everyone,” she recalled.Mumbai: Cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal wearing a face mask to hide his face arrives for the hearing of his divorce with wife Dhanashree Verma, at the Bandra Family Court in Mumbai. (PTI Photo)Dhanashree strongly criticised Chahal’s choice of t-shirt on the divorce hearing.“He walked out first, and that whole t-shirt episode unfolded. I wasn’t even aware of it at the time because I was still inside. I left through the back door because I didn’t want to face the media. I was just wearing a simple t-shirt and jeans.PollWhat are your thoughts on Yuzvendra Chahal's choice of attire at the divorce hearing?Inappropriate and disrespectfulA bold statementCompletely fine, it's his choiceI have no opinion on it“I sat in my car, still trying to catch my breath. Before I even realised what had happened, people began speculating about me because of that stunt. Sitting there, I felt like, ‘It’s done. It’s dusted.’“Somewhere, I did feel bad. Why was I even crying about this? Then I thought, forget it—let’s just end this. That moment gave me the motivation to laugh and move on. It’s over,” she added.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. 

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. 

We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects.

EXPLAINED: Why Shubman Gill got the T20I vice-captaincy over Axar Patel
Shubman Gill has been appointed vice-captain for the Asia Cup 2025 T20I tournament, marking his return to the T20I squad after a two-year absence. Suryakumar Yadav will lead the team, with India set to face UAE and Pakistan in Group A. The Asia Cup serves as crucial preparation for the T20 World Cup in 2026.
Shubman Gill over Axar Patel: The real reason behind India's vice-captaincy shake-up for Asia Cup 2025 | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsShubman Gill over Axar Patel: The real reason behind India's vice-captaincy shake-up for Asia Cup 2025TrendingKagiso RabadaMohammaid KaifSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillAsia CupSalahJasprit BumrahKagiso RabadaMohammaid KaifSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillAsia CupSalahJasprit BumrahKagiso RabadaMohammaid KaifSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillAsia CupSalahJasprit BumrahShubman Gill over Axar Patel: The real reason behind India's vice-captaincy shake-up for Asia Cup 2025TOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 20, 2025, 09:15 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeShubman Gill has been appointed vice-captain for the Asia Cup 2025 T20I tournament, marking his return to the T20I squad after a two-year absence. Suryakumar Yadav will lead the team, with India set to face UAE and Pakistan in Group A. The Asia Cup serves as crucial preparation for the T20 World Cup in 2026. Shubman Gill and Axar Patel  NEW DELHI: India’s Test skipper Shubman Gill has been named vice-captain in India’s 15-member squad for the Asia Cup 2025 T20I tournament, to be held in the UAE from September 9 to 28. The appointment comes more than two years after Gill’s last T20I outing in July 2023, when he had also served as deputy to Suryakumar Yadav.T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav was asked about Gill being chosen ahead of Axar Patel, who had been vice-captain in Gill’s absence.Asia Cup 2025: India Squad Announced | Surya Named Captain, Gill Vice-CaptainGo Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!"The last time he played T20Is for India was when we went to Sri Lanka after the T20 World Cup, not Zimbabwe. I was leading, he was vice-captain, and that's where we started the new cycle for T20 World Cup. After that, he got busy with all the Test series. So, he didn't get the opportunity to play anywhere in T20Is as he got busy playing Test cricket, as well as the Champions Trophy. So, he is there in the squad and they are happy to have him," Suryakumar said at the press conference.Gill’s elevation comes on the back of a promising start as India’s Test captain during the recent series against England.The eight-team Asia Cup will be played in Abu Dhabi and Dubai. Defending champions India are drawn in Group ‘A’ alongside Pakistan, Oman and the UAE.PollDo you agree with Shubman Gill's appointment as vice-captain for the Asia Cup 2025?Yes, he deserves itNo, prefer Axar PatelUnsureOther reasonsIndia will open their campaign against hosts UAE on September 10, before facing arch-rivals Pakistan on September 14 in a marquee clash.Following the Asia Cup, India are scheduled to play 15 more T20Is in the lead-up to the T20 World Cup, which will be jointly hosted by India and Sri Lanka in February 2026.India squad for Asia Cup 2025: Suryakumar Yadav (C), Shubman Gill (VC), Abhishek Sharma, Tilak Varma, Hardik Pandya, Shivam Dube, Axar Patel, Jitesh Sharma (WK), Jasprit Bumrah, Arshdeep Singh, Varun Chakaravarthy, Kuldeep Yadav, Sanju Samson (WK), Harshit Rana, Rinku Singh.Standby players: Prasidh Krishna, Washington Sundar, Dhruv Jurel, Riyan Parag, Yashasvi Jaiswal.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. 'Imran Khan wasn't talented ... used to shout at us': Wasim Akram
Wasim Akram lauded Imran Khan as the greatest captain he played under, highlighting Khan's pivotal role in shaping his career. Akram emphasized that Khan's success stemmed from relentless hard work and determination, exemplified by his willingness to reinvent his bowling action. Imran's leadership instilled confidence in the team, demanding full commitment and intolerance for complacency on the field.
'Imran Khan wasn't talented ... used to shout at us': Wasim Akram spills the beans - WATCH | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperIPL 2025WPLCricket ScheduleLive Cricket ScoreICC RankingsNewsSports NewsCricket News'Imran Khan wasn't talented ... used to shout at us': Wasim Akram spills the beans - WATCHTrendingAakash ChopraMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementICC ODI RankingsShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarAakash ChopraMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementICC ODI RankingsShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil GavaskarAakash ChopraMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek NayarIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementICC ODI RankingsShubman GillDhanashree VermaYuzvendra ChahalSunil Gavaskar'Imran Khan wasn't talented ... used to shout at us': Wasim Akram spills the beans - WATCHTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 20, 2025, 08:40 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeWasim Akram lauded Imran Khan as the greatest captain he played under, highlighting Khan's pivotal role in shaping his career. Akram emphasized that Khan's success stemmed from relentless hard work and determination, exemplified by his willingness to reinvent his bowling action. Imran's leadership instilled confidence in the team, demanding full commitment and intolerance for complacency on the field. Wasim Akram and Imran Khan  NEW DELHI: Pakistan pace legend Wasim Akram has opened up on what it was like to play under Imran Khan, calling the 1992 World Cup-winning skipper the greatest captain he ever played with. Akram, who began his international career in the mid-1980s, credited Imran for shaping him not only as a cricketer but also as a professional.Reflecting on his early days with Pakistan, Akram said much of his development came under Imran’s guidance. Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!"I think whatever I did as a cricketer, off the field, on the field, credit goes to him. He used to give us a lot of confidence. He led from the front. He had a belief in his own ability. He was a hardworking cricketer," Akram said on Stick to Cricket.While many considered Imran a naturally gifted player, Akram stressed that his success was built on relentless effort. "People used to say I'm very naturally talented. Skipper wasn't talented. He worked hard. Remember he changed his bowling action. From 76, exactly. Changing even a little bit of action can take months, it might not happen. But he did change his action. He was so determined," Akram said.Akram emphasised that Imran’s determination and willingness to reinvent himself set an example for the entire team. His hard work, according to Akram, created a culture where no one could afford to be complacent. "I mean he was the best captain I played under. He used to give confidence to every one of us," Akram noted.PollWho do you believe is the greatest cricket captain in history?Imran KhanKapil DevSteve WaughClive LloydAt the same time, Imran was known to be tough on his players when required. Akram explained that the former skipper demanded full commitment on the field. "At times he used to shout at us because if you were lazy, fair enough. He was tough, but he was tough on the field. You give your 100%. If you don’t do well, he was okay with it," he said.However, Imran could not tolerate players who tried to shield themselves in pressure situations. "If you're trying to save yourself and say okay, it's a pressure situation, I’ll just take a back seat — he used to judge. He knew this particular player is just saving himself. So that used to annoy him a lot," Akram revealed.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Isak breaks silence over stalled move to Liverpool; Newcastle hit back
Alexander Isak has publicly expressed his desire to leave Newcastle amidst Liverpool's interest, citing broken promises and lost trust. Despite a rejected £110 million bid, Isak believes a change is in everyone's best interest. Newcastle responded, stating Isak remains under contract and denying any agreement for his departure, while Liverpool seeks attacking reinforcements after key player exits.
Football transfers: Alexander Isak breaks silence over stalled move to Liverpool; Newcastle United hit back | Football News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperEuro 2024Fifa World Cup 2022English Premier LeagueChampions LeagueFootball NewsIndian Super LeagueI-LeagueNewsSports NewsFootballFootball transfers: Alexander Isak breaks silence over stalled move to Liverpool; Newcastle United hit backTrendingHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramUS Open 2025India Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramUS Open 2025India Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarHarbhajan SinghMohammaid KaifWasim AkramUS Open 2025India Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarFootball transfers: Alexander Isak breaks silence over stalled move to Liverpool; Newcastle United hit backTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 20, 2025, 10:18 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeAlexander Isak has publicly expressed his desire to leave Newcastle amidst Liverpool's interest, citing broken promises and lost trust. Despite a rejected £110 million bid, Isak believes a change is in everyone's best interest. Newcastle responded, stating Isak remains under contract and denying any agreement for his departure, while Liverpool seeks attacking reinforcements after key player exits. Alexander Isak has not been involved in Newcastle United's pre-season games or start to the Premier League. (AP) Newcastle striker Alexander Isak has broken his silence regarding his potential transfer to Liverpool, stating his departure would be "in the best interests of everyone" amid speculation of a £110 million bid from the Merseyside club. The Swedish international, who has not played in pre-season or Newcastle's opening game, expressed his frustration over broken promises and lost trust through an Instagram post on Tuesday.Liverpool's reported £110 million bid for the 25-year-old striker was rejected by Newcastle, who are demanding a British transfer record fee of up to £150 million.Isak chose not to attend the Professional Footballers' Association awards ceremony despite being named in the Premier League 2024/25 team of the year.Alexander Isak's Instagram Story on his desired move out of Newcastle United."I've kept quiet for a long time while others have spoken. That silence has allowed people to push their own version of events, even though they know it doesn't reflect what was really said and agreed behind closed doors," Isak posted on Instagram. "The reality is that promises were made and the club has known my position for a long time. To now act as if these issues are only emerging is misleading. When promises are broken and trust is lost, the relationship can't continue. That's where things are for me right now - and why change is in the best interests of everyone, not just myself."Reports suggest Newcastle had promised Isak an improved contract but delayed due to financial sustainability rules.Newcastle responded with their own statement expressing disappointment at Isak's social media post.Statement by Newcastle United in response to Alexander Isak's social media post."We are disappointed to have been alerted to a social media post by Alexander Isak this evening," the club stated. "We are clear in response that Alex remains under contract and that no commitment has ever been made by a club official that Alex can leave Newcastle United this summer. We want to keep our best players, but we also understand players have their own wishes and we listen to their views."The club added that Isak remains part of their family and would be welcomed back when ready to rejoin his teammates.Since joining from Real Sociedad in 2022, Isak has scored 62 goals in 109 appearances for Newcastle, including the winning goal against Liverpool in the League Cup final that ended Newcastle's 70-year trophy drought.Liverpool have already invested £300 million in squad improvements this season while recouping over £200 million through sales.The Merseyside club is seeking attacking reinforcements following the departures of Luis Diaz and Darwin Nunez, and the tragic death of Diogo Jota.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Slammed! 'Axar Patel deserves an explanation for removal from vice-captaincy'
Mohammad Kaif has voiced concerns over Axar Patel's removal as T20I vice-captain, replaced by Shubman Gill after a year's absence. Kaif emphasized that Patel deserved prior notification and an explanation for the decision, especially considering his crucial role in India's T20 World Cup 2024 victory. Patel's consistent all-round performance includes 531 runs and 71 wickets in 71 matches.
Asia Cup 2025 | 'Axar Patel deserves an explanation for removal from vice-captaincy': Ex-India star slams decision | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsAsia Cup 2025 | 'Axar Patel deserves an explanation for removal from vice-captaincy': Ex-India star slams decisionTrendingKagiso RabadaMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarKagiso RabadaMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarKagiso RabadaMohammaid KaifWasim AkramAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementManinder SinghShubman GillDhanashree VermaSalahSunil GavaskarAsia Cup 2025 | 'Axar Patel deserves an explanation for removal from vice-captaincy': Ex-India star slams decisionTOI Sports Desk / TIMESOFINDIA.COM /  Aug 20, 2025, 06:59 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeMohammad Kaif has voiced concerns over Axar Patel's removal as T20I vice-captain, replaced by Shubman Gill after a year's absence. Kaif emphasized that Patel deserved prior notification and an explanation for the decision, especially considering his crucial role in India's T20 World Cup 2024 victory. Patel's consistent all-round performance includes 531 runs and 71 wickets in 71 matches. Axar Patel (BCCI Photo) NEW DELHI: Former India cricketer and commentator Mohammad Kaif has raised concerns over Axar Patel losing the vice-captaincy of the Indian T20I side, with Shubman Gill taking over the role. Patel, who was named deputy to Suryakumar Yadav for the five-match series against England earlier this year, was replaced following Gill’s return to T20Is after a year-long absence.Taking to social media, Kaif questioned the manner in which the change was handled.Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!"I hope Axar Patel was informed about his removal from vice-captaincy in advance and he didn't come to know about it from the press conference. Axar did no wrong so he deserves an explanation," Kaif posted.Patel has cemented his place as a dependable all-rounder across formats, making key contributions in India’s T20 World Cup 2024 triumph. He was named Player of the Match in the semi-final against England for his spell of 3/23.In the final against South Africa, Patel played another pivotal role, scoring 47 off 31 balls when India were reeling at 34/3, and later dismissing Tristan Stubbs to tilt the game in India’s favor.Overall, Patel’s T20I record highlights his consistency — 531 runs at a strike rate of 139.32, along with 71 wickets at an average of 22.12 from 71 matches.India Asia Cup squad press conference: What Ajit Agarkar, Surya said on shocking callsFor the upcoming Asia Cup, India’s selectors have included two other spinners, Kuldeep Yadav and Varun Chakravarthy, in the squad.Among the notable exclusions are Shreyas Iyer and Yashasvi Jaiswal. India will open their Asia Cup campaign against hosts UAE on September 10.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Asia Cup: Shubman Gill is breathing down Suryakumar Yadav's neck
Shubman Gill's elevation to India's T20I vice-captain is a clear sign that he might end up leading the team instead of Suryakumar Yadav in the T20I World Cup at home. There are still seven months to go to the marquee event, and in Indian cricket, things can change in seven hours.
Asia Cup: Shubman Gill is breathing down Suryakumar Yadav's neck | Cricket News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIAsia CupSchedulePoints TableT20 RankingsIND Vs PAK: Face-OffIND Vs BAN: Face-OffToday's ePaperNewsSports NewsCricket NewsAsia Cup: Shubman Gill is breathing down Suryakumar Yadav's neckTrendingKagiso RabadaIND Asia Cup Full SquadSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementAsia Cup Indian OpenersAsia Cup Complete SquadAsia CupShreyas IyerJasprit BumrahKagiso RabadaIND Asia Cup Full SquadSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementAsia Cup Indian OpenersAsia Cup Complete SquadAsia CupShreyas IyerJasprit BumrahKagiso RabadaIND Asia Cup Full SquadSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementAsia Cup Indian OpenersAsia Cup Complete SquadAsia CupShreyas IyerJasprit BumrahAsia Cup: Shubman Gill is breathing down Suryakumar Yadav's neckPratyush Raj / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 18:10 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeShubman Gill's elevation to India's T20I vice-captain is a clear sign that he might end up leading the team instead of Suryakumar Yadav in the T20I World Cup at home. There are still seven months to go to the marquee event, and in Indian cricket, things can change in seven hours. Shubman Gill and Suryakumar Yadav New Delhi: At the start of the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, keyboard warriors had written off Shubman Gill before he could even take strike. His 754 runs in the Test series and series-levelling captaincy, as chairman of selectors Ajit Agarkar rightly mentioned, "exceeded expectations." And Gill's elevation to India's T20I vice-captaincy is no fluke.Remember the India tour of Zimbabwe in 2024, which happened right after India's title triumph in the USA and Caribbean? Gill was the captain of the young Indian team, and the signs were clear that the selectors wanted him in the leadership role. Two years ago, he got the captaincy of Gujarat Titans (GT) in the Indian Premier League (IPL). In his second season, he led his team to the playoffs and then the gruelling five-match Test series in England, where he further stamped his authority.India Asia Cup squad press conference: What Ajit Agarkar, Surya said on shocking callsGo Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!In Indian cricket, a lot can happen in seven hours, let alone the seven months to the T20 World Cup. Shubman was labelled a misfit for T20Is, and here he is going to the Asia Cup as deputy to Suryakumar Yadav, and it makes sense he could lead the team in the 2026 T20I World Cup.Is Gill breathing down Surya's neck? The simple answer is yes.Suryakumar Yadav is still recovering from the sports hernia surgery, and TimesofIndia.com has learnt that he is not yet 100 per cent fit. The selectors have taken a gamble that he will regain his full fitness by the time the Asia Cup kicks off in the UAE next month.Surya is also not getting any younger, and in the middle of the Asia Cup, he would turn 35. This is Surya's third surgery in as many years. After an ankle surgery in 2023, the swashbuckling batter had previously undergone the same sports hernia surgery back in 2024. The recurring injuries has ended careers, and we know what happened with Bhuvneshwar Kumar.Management's back-upChief selector Ajit Agarkar has hinted that Shubman Gill is someone they are looking forward to as a captain across formats.“In both T20 cricket (IPL) and Test cricket Gill is already leading. He was also the vice-captain the last time he played in T20Is. We do see leadership qualities in him, and he showed his quality by exceeding expectations with the bat in England (during the Test series),” Agarkar told reporters on Tuesday.PollDo you think Shubman Gill has proven himself as a leader in the Indian cricket team?Yes, absolutely!Not yet, still needs to prove more.Why is Shubman the right pick?Since the time Gambhir took over the coaching role after India won the T20 World Cup, he has set a template, where he has created room for the IPL generation to take over. Since then, India's batting has reached new heights. A team that prioritises quick scoring and batting depth was able to routinely break the 250-run barrier. They went as high as 297 against Bangladesh in October 2024, which is the third-highest total in T20Is.Abhishek Sharma and Sanju Samson are pivotal to coach Gambhir's template. But they are a high-risk, high-reward kind of opening pair. Gambhir would not want, in a final, India to be 0/2. Shubman's inclusion will most certainly provide stability at one end, with his roommate since U-14 days, Abhishek Sharma, having the luxury to attack right from the outset.Filling big voidWith Shubman Gill, India have found a suitable face to fill the big void left by Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. With his elegant strokeplay, calm demeanour, and youthful appeal, he has already become a fan favourite and with the advertisers.Suryakumar Yadav has had an impressive track record as India’s full-time T20I captain after Rohit Sharma retired from the format following the 2024 T20 World Cup triumph. Under his leadership, India have won 17 out of 22 matches.There is no question about Surya the T20I batter -- he can entertain the crowd. But can he fill stadiums? The answer to that question is again no.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4. Football meets shooting on rain-soaked evening: India's oldest school tournament opens with unique sporting parallel
The 64th Subroto Cup, India's prestigious school football tournament, commenced at New Delhi's Ambedkar Stadium amidst enthusiastic support. Olympian Anjum Moudgil highlighted the recognition differences between individual and team sports, coinciding with Indian shooters' recent international success. Arunachal Pradesh secured a narrow victory in the opening match, setting a promising tone for the tournament, nurturing young football talent.
Football meets shooting on rain-soaked evening: India's oldest school tournament opens with unique sporting parallel | Football News - Times of IndiaEditionININUSEnglishEnglishहिन्दीमराठीಕನ್ನಡதமிழ்বাংলাമലയാളംతెలుగుગુજરાતીWeatherSign InTOIsportsCricketNFLNBANHLCollege FootballMLCAsia Cup 2025Live Cricket ScoreMLBEsportsInternational SportsFormula EWWEF1MMATennisBadmintonHockeyWeb StoriesVideosRacingAthleticsWrestlingShootingBoxingChessIPL 2025Today's ePaperEuro 2024Fifa World Cup 2022English Premier LeagueChampions LeagueFootball NewsIndian Super LeagueI-LeagueNewsSports NewsFootballFootball meets shooting on rain-soaked evening: India's oldest school tournament opens with unique sporting parallelTrendingKagiso RabadaIND Asia Cup Full SquadSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementAsia Cup Indian OpenersAsia Cup Complete SquadAsia CupShreyas IyerJasprit BumrahKagiso RabadaIND Asia Cup Full SquadSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementAsia Cup Indian OpenersAsia Cup Complete SquadAsia CupShreyas IyerJasprit BumrahKagiso RabadaIND Asia Cup Full SquadSuryakumar YadavAbhishek SharmaIndia Asia Cup Squad AnnouncementAsia Cup Indian OpenersAsia Cup Complete SquadAsia CupShreyas IyerJasprit BumrahFootball meets shooting on rain-soaked evening: India's oldest school tournament opens with unique sporting parallelSherwin Shaju / TIMESOFINDIA.COM / Updated: Aug 19, 2025, 23:32 ISTShareAA+Text SizeSmallMediumLargeThe 64th Subroto Cup, India's prestigious school football tournament, commenced at New Delhi's Ambedkar Stadium amidst enthusiastic support. Olympian Anjum Moudgil highlighted the recognition differences between individual and team sports, coinciding with Indian shooters' recent international success. Arunachal Pradesh secured a narrow victory in the opening match, setting a promising tone for the tournament, nurturing young football talent.  Football meets shooting on rain-soaked evening in Subroto Cup (Special Arrangements)  NEW DELHI: Under ominous black clouds casting their spell over Delhi’s skyline, the Subroto Cup, India's oldest national school football tournament, roared to life with its 64th edition at the Ambedkar Stadium on Tuesday. Despite heavy rain in the morning hours of the day, leaving carpets soaked and the turf damp, hundreds of students and army officers in the stands cheered on to undo the damage dealt by the weather. Olympian and Arjuna Award-winning shooter Anjum Moudgil, the guest of honour for the opening ceremony, drew an exciting comparison between team sports like football and something deeply individual like shooting. While shooting remains less accessible compared to team sports like football in India, she said that individual sports are more lucrative than playing for a team. Go Beyond The Boundary with our YouTube channel. SUBSCRIBE NOW!That difference, she said, lies at the heart of how recognition comes to athletes. “Yes, they are different in terms of recognition. When you win a medal, obviously you get more attention than a team,” she told TimesofIndia.com on the sidelines of the Subroto Cup.The words of the former world number one in 50m 3 position rifle come at a time when Indian shooters are riding a wave of success. Manu Bhaker set the tone at the Paris 2024 Olympics with two bronze medals, while Suruchi Singh, Arya Borse, Arjun Babuta, Sift Kaur Samra and Elavenil Valarivan all made their mark at the ISSF World Cup of late. On Tuesday, Bhaker added another bronze at the Asian Shooting Championships in Kazakhstan. On the pitch, however, the first match of the tournament lived up to its billing. Players of Arunachal Pradesh (green) and Sainik School, Odisha, vie for the ball during the Junior Girls Under-17 match at 64th Subroto Cup International Football Tournament (PTI Photo)Arunachal Pradesh edged past Sainik School 1-0 in the junior girls’ category, thanks to an early first-half strike. Sainik School had two goals ruled out for offside, but the contest brimmed with spirit, making it a fitting start to a competition that continues to nurture India’s next generation of footballers.With the Subroto Cup bringing in yet another generation of talented footballers, and shooters continuing to collect medals on the international stage, India’s sporting future looks brighter than ever.The junior girls’ competition runs until August 28, with the sub-junior boys and junior boys categories set to follow. The tournament comes to a close on September 25, with the final of the junior boys category.Catch Rani Rampal's inspiring story on Game On, Episode 4.
